choices: You start exploring, maybe hoping to find someone to help
Make for the trail, hoping to maybe get back to town
You decide to try and find shelter, give yourself time to think
1.content:
You find yourself hiking up the trail, adjusting your pack as you sigh to yourself. Another lousy day in town...another lousy day of work. Ah well, it paid enough to keep your hobby going at least.

Supposedly every person in this world is supposed to go on their own 'magical' pokemon journey, and while on this trail you occasionally ran into the passing kid trying to catch a pokemon. Not you, you never did that. You found yourself helping at home too much around that age and just never got out and did it. You never much regretted it, but when you saw pokemon in the wild when you walked this trail your mind drifted to what it might've been like.

Your pack was digging into one of your shoulders as you went to adjust it again when you heard a rustle from the bushes. You stopped for a second to look, and a quiet moment passed before you decided there was nothing there. Probably a pokemon you thought. You continued until you found a nice boulder to take a slight rest on and sat down, opening your pack to pull out an energy bar and bottle of water. You quietly indulged yourself in the food and drink as you let your mind drift.

These hikes helped you to refresh yourself, get away from the hustle and bustle, and occasionally see a pokemon, maybe pet it or give it a bit of food before it went on its merry way.

You finished the bar, watching the trees and the wind rustle the grass and such before you took the empty bar and wrapper and placed them into a part of your bag to dispose of when you got back to town.

You hoisted the bag onto your back and continued on, whistling a little tune to yourself.

This kept on for a while, and you reached the end of where you normally hike and circle around, it was where the trail ended...a portion of trees continued on and you never ventured into it yourself. You didn't really know of anyone that had.

You went to turn around before a thought came to you...maybe you should check it out...you'd been doing this same hike for a long time, seeing something new would be fun right? Maybe you'd see a type of pokemon you'd never seen. Heck, who knows.

It was with that that you decided to step off the trail. You ventured into the grass, past the unknown treeline and kept going.

It seemed relatively normal too, just more berry bushes, more trees, more of the same, you hadn't seen a pokemon when you felt something odd coming over you...your vision felt like it was blurring and your pack was getting heavier.

"Must be getting tired..." You mumbled to yourself when a bout of lightheadedness took you as well. You went to set your pack down and when you did you collapsed forward, onto the ground.

-

When you opened your eyes the darkness of night was around you, that was the first thing you noted. You went to get up and for some reason noted that you didn't have any clothes on.

Wait...

"What the hell!?" You yelled out. Did someone rob you of the clothes on your back!

You stood up and found yourself standing on some sort of tarp.

You looked into the distance to see a canopy of...some sort too. It looked denim? You looked around, though the night was dark your eyes adjusted quick thanks to the star and moonlight above and the grass...looked tall. Some taller than you?

You looked down at the tarp and saw a familiar design on it...the one on your shirt. You looked back again to see a rising monument...that looked like your pack.

It was registering in your brain that something bizarre had happened...you'd shrunk!

"That's not possible..." You whispered out, afraid of the truth as a breeze blew by and you rubbed your arms shivering. Damn you were cold too.

"Okay...okay...calm down..." You said to yourself. You needed a plan.
1.title: The beginning

choices: The Umbreon could have helped you, you approached her!
You couldn't risk! You sneaked past the Umbreon and ran from her!
11.content:
Your teeth chattering, you slowly folded your arms and began rubbing for warmth, not sure of what you should have done.

Getting help seemed impossible right now, how could you even get any? You were impossibly tiny. The chance of someone passing by overnight was quite low.

But then, what could you do?

"Come on... think..." you murmured to yourself as you started walking in circles, trying to collect your thoughts.

You had to do something to at least survive throughout the night. You could have done a lot more to improve your situation when you were a lot less cold and able to think straight.

Your freshly awakened mind told you that the wise thing to do here was trying to remain awake for the night; you knew for sure this place housed many pokemon, and you couldn't be sure of what they'd have done if they found you...

As if on cue, a nearby bush began rustling, drawing your attention while also making you spring up in alert.

Slowly, you turned your head to the source of the noise, discovering a few bushes rustling indeed.

At first, you thought it was because of the damn wind that threatened to send you straight in a state of hypothermia.

But then, you realized that it wasn't the wind; on the other side of that bush, you noted with curiosity mixed to sheer terror, there was some sort of yellow light.

To avoid screaming, giving away your location to whatever - or whoever - was approaching as a result, you bit your tongue and sprinted in the opposite direction.

Hastily, like a child playing hide and seek, you dove right behind your now monolithic bag, your heart beating faster that normal and your brain racing.

Right then, the leaves of the bush parted ways as a figure finally came out. It was a pokemon.

You analyzed it carefully while trying to remember its name;

It was quadruped, had two big ears, red eyes, dark-furred body and, bizarrely, was covered in yellow rings, which emitted that yellow light that warned you of the pokemon's presence. You finally remembered the name of the Eeveelution.

It was an Umbreon. And it looked a lot less adorable and a lot more dangerous than its pre-evolution.

The dark-type stopped in its tracks as it noticed your bag, abandoned in the middle of the woods.

It could never have seen the real reason behind its loneliness in a patch of grass... or could it? Umbreon were dark-types, could they see through darkness as well? You struggled to remember, but couldn't really think straight while the ground shook so loudly as the Umbreon approached your bag, curious.

You peered from your hiding spot to see the gigantic Eeveelution getting dangerously close to your location, though it was headed for the opposite side of your bag.

Before you could think of anything smart that could have pulled you out of this mess, the Umbreon halted its walk right in front of your bag and neared its muzzle to it, beginning to sniff it curiously.

You choked back a sigh of relief as you kept staring at the beast from the other side of the monumental bag, the light emanating from its rings blinding you. It felt like staring at the sun in the middle of the night.

It could have easily eaten you if it spotted you, you reasoned. But if this Umbreon was innocuous, at least to you, it could also have helped you sort out this messed-up situation.

Said giant suddenly stood on its hind legs, while its fore-legs pushed against your bag.

You watched as the Umbreon dove its head inside the opening of the bag without spotting you.

Again, you felt the need to sigh. It hadn't noticed you.

Oddly, from this angulation and from the Umbreon's new position, you had a pretty view of its hind quarters, and you noticed, enlightened by the light of its rings, a thin, damp pink slit jumping out on the endless black fur.

You blushed furiously at the realization that this Umbreon was a girl.

As for the giantess, she seemed to have lost interest in your bag; you could tell by the way she pulled its head out of the opening, shook it several times before falling back on all fours, causing an immense earthquake to shake the ground beneath your feet while also making you fall down as well, though you landed on your rear end.

"Ow..." you murmured before noticing the immense wall that was your bag trembling beside you.

And you watched with horror as it began falling down, probably from the impact of Umbreon's paws on the ground, though you doubted it.

But it was no time to think about possibilities, you were about to be crushed!

"Ah!" you screamed in alert as you ran from the looming bag; you barely made it out from behind it as it fell down, causing yet another tremor that shook the ground beneath you.

"Phew!" you sighed in relief, before remembering what situation you were in.

Your lungs and heart freezing, you gingerly looked upwards; predictably, the Umbreon heard you screaming and was in alert as well.

She pointed her nose upwards and began sniffing the air, before looking back down at the ground. Ironically, it seemed to have taken a lot of interest in the patch of grass you were currently hiding in, though you were hidden by the towering, leafless green trees.

You watched as the giantess bent and started scanning the ground, searching for the source of that smell she picked up.

You gulped. If you weren't able to decide what to do earlier, this was the proper moment.

Now or never.
11.title: A shady appearance

choices: ...But she found that you tasted delicious!
She made her way back to her home with you.
Suddenly, another pokemon approached the Umbreon.
113.content:
As you shivered, both from the cold and from fear you were trying to decide quickly if you should get the Umbreon's attention, or evade her entirely.

The whole thing you found was a moot point, as the grass you were in was parted by an immense dark paw, and the red eyes of the Umbreon were staring straight at you. It no longer mattered what you wanted, she knew you were there and you very much doubted you could get away from her.

Looking at her staring at you was an altogether different experience than when she was unaware of you. The staring contest into her looming, far above face only reinforced how puny...insignificant you were.

Your jaw tried to work, though the cold made it hard and you found that fear was gripping your throat, though with a squeak you did manage the words. "Please d-don't hurt me..." You said and the Umbreon tilted her head as she regarded you. A shadow loomed closer as she lowered her head to you, you winced and stumbled back, falling flat on your butt as she sniffed at you with her nose, sucking in air around you as she took in your scent. You were pinned down by her wet nose to the ground as she pushed you down with it gently, sniffing harder while keeping you safely pinned.

You tried to push her nose away though it was ultimately futile, as her minimal effort was more than enough to outmatch all of what little strength you had right now.

After about a minute of this she lifted her nose off of you and now you had damp liquid from it coating you, making you shiver even more. The Umbreon seemed to notice how cold you were at least, and she lowered her head once again.

"What now...?" You asked in fear, and that's when you noted that her mouth opened and you cried out.

"No! Please don't!" You said, as her maw got closer and you got up to run, though by the time you did a slimy muscle scooped you up, her tongue, and you found yourself in a moist, dark cave...her mouth...looking at teeth that could dice you up instantly.

"Don't eat me please! I don't want to die!"

The Umbreon had no intent to eat you before she picked you up, she was going to carry you away.
113.title: Umbreon knows of you

choices: Indeed, the cave was deserted aside from you and Umbreon
Another Eeveelution showed up; looks like this cave wasn't so deserted
1132.content:
In front of you, razor-sharp fangs; behind you, an abyss of no return that led to a certain death; all around you, pink muscles and a red floor that fidgeted constantly, causing you to feel nauseous. The drops of saliva that kept falling from the palate, soaking you to the bone, didn't really help with that.

But unlike the freezing outside, the insides of the Umbreon's mouth were warm, the risk of freezing to death was null in here. That obviously was a dumb thought, because you could die in two different ways in here: either torn apart by the teeth or falling down into the stomach, into the Umbreon's digestive tract, which was going to be your end unless you found your way out in time.

And the thought of crawling through this beast's intestines surely didn't seem appealing to you.

"Let me out!" you cried once more while doing your best to stand back on your feet; the slippery tongue made such task practically impossible.

You were ungracefully flipped over and fell on your rear into a small puddle of saliva under the large red muscle.

Soon enough, the tongue was on you again.

It began licking you as its owner tasted you.

Your heart began beating faster. Was this Umbreon really going to eat you? You only came to the woods to take a break and you end up eaten by a random pokemon.

Your grave was going to be a stomach, and no one would have ever known you were dead.

The thought sure left a bitter taste in your mouth...

You felt movement and the mouth shook all around you; the Umbreon was probably walking around, you figured while the tongue swept you up and took you on top of itself again.

Saliva build up all around. Thinking about, you had been in here for a while already, why didn't the Umbreon swallow yet.

You were given no time to ponder about it, because the tongue suddenly moved again; it rose rose up, shoving you against the palate, crushing you in between tons of sticky flesh.

"LET ME OUT!" you screamed once more as you fidgeted, desperately hoping to convince the giantess to not eat you.

But there was no way out of here unless the Umbreon willed it.

... Or unless you used your intellect to find your way out of this mess!

"I'd be more useful alive! I-I... I can be a pet or something, just don't eat me!" you shouted.

The idea of submitting to this dark-type wasn't really one you'd call appealing, but is was surely better than melting away into a stomach, spending you final moments wondering what did you do to deserve all this.

You opened your mouth to make a second offer, but you were immediately silenced by a particularly big drop of saliva falling right on your head and into your mouth, choking you.

Utterly disgusted, you spat out the saliva that wasn't yours.

Outside, the Umbreon kept walking through the woods as she headed home, thinking about her latest catch.

A shrunken human no less.

She felt the little guy struggle and plead inside her mouth, and she somewhat enjoyed it, like she enjoyed his taste.

However, as much as she wanted to swallow right now, Umbreon was a lot more interested in examining the little one when he was alive.

She just needed to get home, or other pokemon could have stolen you from her. No one was taking the human she had taken for herself until he was in the relative safety of her mouth.

The dark-type moaned as she tasted you once more.

It was sure getting hard to fight back the urge to swallow...

--

An eternity of you pointlessly fighting back the giant tongue passed.

You tried countless other times to convince the Umbreon to let you go, most of those ending with you getting a mouthful of spittle.

Beaten, tired and unable to formulate anymore pleads, you simply laid still on top of the tongue as it tasted you repeatedly.

You didn't have the strength to fight back anymore.

Suddenly, your surroundings began to shake once again, like they hadn't in a while now; the tongue began moving beneath you as it dragged you forward.

This was it, you bitterly thought, you were going to be thrown in the back of this beast's throat, only to be then swallowed, providing the Umbreon a nice midnight snack before she resumed her nighttime walk, completely forgetting that you ever existed while you faced a painful death in her stomach before your corpse was disposed of in the most humiliating way you could think of.

Such thoughts, you figured, were worthy of the most obnoxious nightmares of the human mind.

But this was no nightmare, it was the hard reality: you were about to be eaten!

You watched with horror as the tongue rose up again and... cold.

The warmth of the slippery cave rapidly dissipated as cold air entered; you began sliding forward, carried by a thick glob of saliva. Then, something hard under your back as your location was shifted from the Umbreon's insides to a stone floor.

Your eyes met with the sight of the dark-type giantess staring at you, those bright red eyes of hers focused on your form and a curious expression on her muzzle.

"H-Huh...?"

You took notice that you were inside of a cave. Not exactly the warmest place you could think of, but surely better than the frosty forest.

You stared back at the Umbreon with the same interest, wondering the reason why she hadn't eaten you like she probably intended...

Realization hit you: this giantess probably never wanted to eat you, she just took you away!

For what reason, you could only wonder.

Your eyes once again locked with the red ones of the Umbreon that kept staring at you, examining your naked, saliva-covered body with interest.

You could at least understand that, it's not every day a pokemon can meet a shrunken human. And, most importantly, it's not every day a human gets to randomly shrink down, although, between the cold and the near heart attack you got from being almost eaten by the same Umbreon, you quickly decided that you already had your taste of being small, and you didn't like it one bit.

The red gaze of the Umbreon was truly unnerving though, which was empathized by the fact her oculars were absolutely gigantic. Plus, it didn't speak a word and the silence only contributed to make you feel even more uncomfortable.

To keep your mind off things for at least a moment, until the Umbreon decided to do something with you, you decided to take a look around.

This cave seemed deserted, but it was really big, you noted.

Who knew, maybe there was another or more inhabitants inside?
1132.title: Saved by a shadow

choices: Umbreon sat back down, inadvertently shoving you up her vagina!
Umbreon sat back down, accidentally pushing you up her rear!
Sylveon turned around, noticing you beneath Umbreon!
11322.content:
Deciding there was nothing worthy your interest inside of what was just a simple, empty cavern, you decided to look back at you dark-type captor, who was still staring at you intently.

But then, the Umbreon, seemingly satisfied with her examination, opened her mouth.

For a moment, you thought she wanted to take you inside again and eat you for real this time, but nothing happened; instead, the giantess inhaled softly, seemingly wanting to say something - which you wouldn't understand though - but she didn't manage to speak.

Soft footsteps resonated inside the empty cave, the sound of feet (paws?) hitting the stone floor crystal clear.

You barely had time to process that someone was coming your way before the Umbreon in front of you stood up, towering above you.

You had little time to ‘admire’ how big she was, because you discovered her rear suddenly lowering, coming down on you!

Before you could think of anything, before you even had the time to inhale and scream, the soft mountain of black fur landed on you as the Umbreon sat on top of you, hiding you under her behind.

Pressure.

You felt the immense weight on your spine; you attempted to scream in pain but, with your lungs currently being crushed, you found such task extremely hard.

The soft tail of the giantess tickled your soles.

Your gaze was blurry and the air carried the scent of the Umbreon; looking straight forward, you could see the thin, pink slit you noted before.

You were extremely, if not dangerously, close to it. If you leaned a but closer, your head could touch it.

Your face flared up to an almost steaming level. You tried to crawl backwards, away from the giant organ, but your back came in contact with something hard. It felt... wrinkled.

Your reddened face became white as a sheet all of a sudden as you realized you were also in proximity of the Umbreon's anus.

You were terrified: in front of you, the chance of being shoved up the giantess' vagina; behind, the dreadful thought you could be sucked up her butt.

Your only hope was that the Umbreon stood up again, or at least didn't fidget around too much, because if she did...

Meanwhile, the dark-type stared nervously at the pink and white Eeveelution that came from the depths of the cave.

Sylveon stretched a bit, probably woken up by Umbreon herself, returning to the cave they both shared after her nighttime walk.

"Oh... you're back..." the pixie yawned as she moved closer to her dark-type counterpart.

"You're back early tonight..."

The flustered Umbreon rose her forelegs a bit, shrugging. She didn't quite know how she could explain the shrunken human under her butt if Sylveon knew of him.

The best thing seemed to hide her catch for now. Hopefully, Sylveon wasn't going to find about the human.

Said fairy-type moved closer to Umbreon.

"Are you alright? You look weird..." she pointed out.

"I don't know what you're talking about. I'm fine." Umbreon replied nonchalantly.

From your current entrapment, you could hear muffled voices, but you couldn't distinguish the words.

It was probably the Umbreon that was currently putting you through this and whoever was in the cave with her.

During your stay under her rear, your trap grew hot to unbearable levels, while the dark fur that tickled every side of your body was becoming damp with sweat.

You tried to struggle under the crushing weight, but only managed to squirm pointlessly.

Or almost pointlessly, because your struggles to break free from the Umbreon tickled her in the most sensitive area of her body.

The dark-type yelped as her cheeks grew red - the critter was tickling her crotch.

If she didn't do something soon, Sylveon was going to find out about her catch.

"Hey, are you feeling fine? You're all red!" said fairy exclaimed, concerned.

Umbreon hastily formulated a plan - this was her only chance to make the shrunken human quit struggling. She would have all the time to examine him attentively later, when Sylveon wasn't around.

But for now, you needed to stop tickling her, it was getting really bothersome as well as making Sylveon wonder what was going on.

"Umbreon, what's going on?" Sylveon asked, growing more and more suspicious of Umbreon's weird behavior.

The dark-type fidgeted nervously.

"It's-" she trailed off.

Umbreon's flustered gaze went from Sylveon to a random corner of the cave; predictably, the fairy-type followed Umbreon's gaze and turned around to check whatever was making the dark-type so agitated.

Seeing the pixie distracted, Umbreon took the opportunity and hastily lifted her rear in mid-air; for a moment, you breathed fresh air again, free from the crushing pressure of the large butt and from the giant tail that kept tickling your feet throughout your whole time under the giantess.

You greedily inhaled as much air as you could before looking at the looming crotch that hovered above you: it was lowering again!

Hastily, you tried to move, but the huge behind was already coming back down on you...
11322.title: A tight situation

choices: You touch one of Umbreon's egg cells and fertilizet by mistake
You touch her G-spot,and you're ok
113221.content:
As Umbreon sat back down, you got shoved up her vigina. You began to squirm around, not knowing where you are in this dark and warm environment.

"Ahhhh~" She moaned, feeling you move around in her spacial area. Sylveon looked back.

"You know, you're just acting too wierd, I'm just going to leave" She said, as she left grom once she came. Umbreon stood up and looked around, but she didn't find you.

You kept going deeper and deeper within Umbreon's vigina untill you reached her womb. She was moaning and blushing all through it. You crawled inside her womb, thinking it was an exit, and looked around. While you did that, Umbreon came and gave out the loudest moan yet.

You touch something that makes Umbreon worried
113221.title: Umbreon sat back down, inadvertently shoving yo...

choices: your pleasure(you're going to be a father)
1132211.content: But how was it fertilized?
1132211.title: You touch one of Umbreon's egg cells and fe...

choices: Umbreon forces you the rest of the way up.
Sylveon finds you before Umbreon can react.
113222.content:
Wheezing, you sit up to relieve the pain from your chest. It was hard to focus from the lack of oxygen you got in the last few moments. Breathing has never felt better in all your life.

You look up as your vision starts to clear, just in time to see a giant, black blur coming straight at you again. However, you realize that now you're sitting up, meaning your body is above your waist, where Umbreon's anus was not 2 seconds ago. The horror of your predicament hits right when a soft but firm texture hit's the top of your head, putting weight on your spine.

The pressure started to build up very quickly, but since you were straight up, you couldn't fall over quick enough.

The weight ended suddenly, as you feel the muscle give way. You feel the smooth muscle slide over your face, open quickly over your shoulders, and glide down your body, stopping at your waist, squeezing hard when it stopped.

-----------

Umbreon, knowing she had to quickly stop her catch from tickling and stimulating her, quickly stood up while Sylveon was distracted. However, she knew she had less than a second to sit back down before Sylveon looked back, not even enough time to readjust her hiding place. She just had to hope that the human either took a hint, or knocks him unconscious.

As Sylveon turned back, Umbreon quickly sat back down. Right before hitting the ground, she felt something touch her butthole. Realization hit quickly, but she had no time to react.

She winced at the pain from her hole being bore into, until she felt it relax and give way, sending her catch into her. She felt his body quickly glide through her sphincter, horrified at what happened. However, her face started to blush, and she couldn't deny it felt pretty good. She hit the ground with him still stuck there, and she subconsciously clenched around him.

"What happened? What are you hiding?" Sylveon exclaimed, shacking Umbreon from her stupor.

" I... I don't know what you mean!" Umbreon stammered back, knowing she messed up.

"Come on sister, I know you better than that. Besides, I saw you wince when you sat back down. You're hiding something under you."

------------

Panic sets in as you refocus on your situation. You're halfway stuck inside the colon of this giantess, with your legs still on the outside. Your feet are still being tickled by Umbreon's tail.

Suprisingly, it doesn't smell nearly that bad inside her. Of course it smells, but not nearly as bad as you thought it should. Makes sense for a pokemon that only eats berries. However, the fact that shocks you more is that you can breath inside her.

That still doesn't change the fact that you have no intention of being shoved into the backside of this Pokemon. You start squirming, but your arms are pinned to your sides, and you can't get any leverage to push you out of her anus.

------------

"You better not be sneaking another Hondew berry. You know those are my favorite" Sylveon admonishes as she starts to walk around Umbreon.

Umbreon panics as she feels her catch's feet beneath her tail, knowing he can be seen from under her, and this would be very difficult to explain. While he begins to wiggle, stimulating her more, she knows she only has one option left.
113222.title: Oh no...

choices: You understand them...and don't like this one bit!
You understand them...and conceded that they had a point.
All you heard was them speaking their names and grunting
113223.content:
You tried to crawl away as the crotch was coming down on you, like a meteor when both you and the Umbreon stopped as Sylveon noticed you. She was looking right at you and tilted her head.

"Is that...a tiny human?" She asked, curious as she approached you. Soon the fairy type was looming over you and you noticed her ribbon like appendage coming towards you. You tried to back away but it was fruitless as it wrapped around you and lifted you to her giant blue eyes.

"Yeah...it is. I brought him here." Umbreon sighed, knowing she was caught.

"Umbreon, where did you find him?" The Sylveon asked as she looked you over and the Umbreon gave an annoyed look to Sylveon.

"I found a pack abandoned and him beside it...I just got him here only to find you here as well before I could do anything with him." Umbreon said and Sylveon gave a small frown to the dark type.

"What were you thinking of doing?" She asked only to get a shrug.

"Dunno, hadn't sorted anything out yet. He decided to squirm when I had him pinned and I tried to readjust but you found him just now...I wasn't going to kill him or anything if that's what you're worried about." Umbreon said as she approached Sylveon, but you found yourself moving, your stomach squirming as the Sylveon readjusted her ribbon to put you behind her head, putting you out of Umbreon's reach.

"Oh come on Syl, I just want to have some fun."

"Umbreon, this is a tiny defenseless creature, you probably scared him half to death!" She scolded and Umbreon just rolled her eyes at this.

"Well do you have any ideas on what we should do?" Umbreon said and Sylveon brought you back out to look you over.

"Um...we could take him to town...right?" She said unsure, and got a scoff in return from Umbreon.

"Brilliant, we'll get captured, and he'll get experimented on by humans because there's no way in hell that they wouldn't do that to an anomaly like him. You know how humans are...if anything, getting him like this means that maybe he can pay us back for his species." The Umbreon got a rather menacing grin at this only for Sylveon to move you again.

"He hasn't done anything to us, seriously Umbreon...but...you might be right about the town thing." Sylveon looked dejected at this only for Umbreon's grin to fade to a normal smile.

"Tell ya what, why don't we just keep him? A little pet for us! You can keep him from getting hurt and he can pay us back for taking care of him." The Umbreon said and Sylveon furrowed her brow, closing her eyes in thought.

"Well...I guess...we could try it." She said.

As for you in all of this...
113223.title: Sylveon's discovery and Umbreon's suggestion

1132232.content:
You were completely baffled as the two Pokemon talked to each other. Not only could you understand them talking about making you their pet, you found yourself agreeing with them! While the concept of being a pet made you uncomfortable the Umbreon made a fine point; you had no idea how the human world would react to you. However, one thing that was for certain was this Sylveon and Umbreon both expressed a desire to keep and protect you. In this circumstance it was a lucky blessing they found you and not some Pokemon that would have saw a shrunken human as a potential snack.

The Umbreon chuckled. "Poor little guy probably has no idea what we're talking about."

Pushing against the fur of Sylveon's head you took the chance to get in on the conversation and spoke up. "Actually, I can." Sylveon's velvety ribbons shifted against you and you soon found yourself before her large blue eyes again. Even though they seemed friendly you still had to swallow down your fear as you looked up at her huge face. "Um... I was hiking in the forest, passed out and when I woke up I was like this. Now, and I don't know why, but I can understand you."

The Sylveon looked shocked but as Umbreon walked over she appeared to be very amused. Apparently being able to understand them made you much more interesting and you began to feel crowded as the two Pokemon took up your peripheral vision. "You can? What do you think about being our cute little pet?" The Umbreon asked in a playful, mocking tone.

"Umbreon..." Sylveon scolded.

"It's probably for the best," you sighed. Both the eeveelution's eyes widened in surprise and the Sylveon pulled you closer, eager for an explanation. "Umbreon was right, I'm not sure what they would do to me if they found me like this. It's the safest option for me right now."

The two of them looked absolutely delighted. "Well if you want you can absolutely stay with us! We're going to take good care of you, right Umbreon?" The dark-type gave an exaggerated nod in response.

"Um, thank you," you muttered. The fact that you willfully agreed to become a pet was catching up to you and It was almost unbearably embarrassing. Although, even as you felt your cheeks burning there was one more aspect that needed to be discussed. "Umbreon, what did you mean when you said I was going to pay you two back?"

The dark-type gave you a toothy grin. "Wouldn't you like to know," she teased. "You'll find out soon enough."

Sylveon sighed at her before she turned back to you. "The next time I see Alakazam I'll ask him to look into what made you so small, okay?. He's really smart!"

"Oh, thank you!"

Her ribbons shifted against you and she gave a soft smile. "That's a task for another day, though. For now I guess you're going to be spending time with us."

"Pass him here, I want to play with him." Umbreon said. You flinched as she started moving her head closer to you but you were lifted out of reach by Sylveon's ribbons.

"Don't you think you should ask him first? Maybe he would like to spend time with me, instead."

"But he's our pet," Umbreon said as matter of fact. "Why would I have to ask him?"

Sylveon sighed at her again before pulling you close. "She means well, honest."

"Fine," Umbreon conceded. "Who do you want to hang out with first, little guy?"

While you would rather spend some time alone to come to terms with your new size, it would be rude to reject spending time with the two Pokemon that were going out of their way to help you. The obvious choice would be the one that was acting more protective and sympathetic, the Sylveon. While you just met, you could tell she would treat you right and not force you more out of your comfort zone than you already were. Then again, you were still considering going with Umbreon. She clearly had grievances against the human race that would reflect on how she plays with you but it might be good to let her get all those feelings out of her system sooner rather than later. The dark-type was even staring at you intensely as if she was trying to will you to pick her.

Whom do you pick?
1132232.title: Acceptant pet

choices: She's planning something pretty humiliating...but hopefully harmless
She plans to play rough with you
11322322.content:
You hoped you wouldn't regret this...but sooner or later you'd be spending time with Umbreon, and she didn't intend to kill you at least...Sylveon would definitely be gentler, but ultimately it'd probably be better to connect with Umbreon early...and you didn't know if she'd attempt to retaliate later if you DIDN'T pick her right now. You nodded before you opened your mouth to speak, looking Umbreon in the eye.

"I'll go with you Umbreon, you did find me after all." Umbreon gave a pretty toothy grin as she looked satisfied with herself. "That's right, I did little guy, and we're gonna have lots of fun." Sylveon looked at you with a bit of hesitation before she smiled. "Well...okay, if you're fine with it too then..." She then shifted her attention to Umbreon, who looked as eager as a kid about to get a toy. "Please don't push things too far...I know how you can get." Sylveon said gently as Umbreon rolled her eyes.

"I get it, I know how puny and frail he is, I won't break him." You gulped at her wording as the dark type approached the ribbons, opening her mouth before you felt yourself harshly yanked high up by Sylveon's ribbons. "What are you doing!?" Sylveon asked in shock as to her it looked like you were about to be eaten. Umbreon just huffed. "I don't have any fancy appendages to grab him like you! I carried him here in my mouth anyway, it's fine." Umbreon said as Sylveon shook her head as she looked at you.

"You were carried in her mouth...?" Sylveon asked as you nodded before she looked at Umbreon biting her lip before she smiled again. "Well, why don't you let him ride on your back? If he grabs on it should be fine." Sylveon said as Umbreon started to look more annoyed and impatient.

"Whatever, just hand him over okay?" Umbreon said as you felt yourself moving through the air, and gently dropped into midnight black fur...it stretched out all around you.

"Have fun!" Sylveon said with a smile, not sure if she was addressing you, Umbreon or both.

"Yeah yeah, i'll be back in a while." Umbreon said as she went deeper into the cave, down some twists and turns as you looked around you. There was no way you'd be able to find your way back to Sylveon on your own as Umbreon felt like she was entering a maze.

"So you don't know what happened to you?" Umbreon's voice broke the silence as you blinked before hastily answering.

"N-no, it just kinda...happened while I was hiking..." You said. Umbreon let off a hmph as she was silent for a second before asking another question.

"You ain't a trainer, are ya?" The tone was a little harsher as you gulped.

"N-no...never really wanted to be one." You said. Umbreon didn't respond to this as she kept walking. That's when you decided to break the silence.

"Um...thanks for not eating me." You said, hoping to try and maybe try to get on her good side.

"Wouldn't be as fun if I ate you so quick." You couldn't see her smirk at this, but you felt terrified all the same. You didn't know if she noticed or not, but she chimed in a few seconds later. "Relax, it's a joke...pretty sure Sylveon would let me have it at this point if I tried a stunt like that anyway." Umbreon said. You didn't know what Umbreon would've done to you if Sylveon hadn't come along, but now you were really starting to wonder how safe you'd be with this dark type eeveelution.
11322322.title: Picking Umbreon

choices: Satisfied and ready to tone it down
113223223.content:
After a short while of walking you could feel Umbreon stop and lower herself down to the ground. The two of you were deep enough in the cave that the only source of light were the glowing yellow rings adorning the dark-types body. Their light reflected off the cave walls and you could see that you were in a small chamber that was apparently the end of the cave system. While you were taking in your surroundings you were interrupted when Umbreon impatiently wiggled her back. "Climb down."

Not wanting to annoy her you began to climb down. It was easy going at first but as you cleared the bulk of her back and got to her sides you had to clench fist-fulls of black fur in your hands to keep you from falling. Slowly but surely, you scaled down the Pokemon until your feet contacted the cool stone floor, stumbling back as Umbreon suddenly stood on all fours. She leisurely circled around you like a predator eyeing up its prey before she came to a stop before you.

Umbreon was staring at you and her red eyes were piercing you to your very core. The only sound in the cave was the sound of her sharply breathing through her nose and you couldn't read if her expression was angry or excited. Whatever it was, it was making you incredibly nervous. "Um... Umbreon, I've never had a Pokemon as a pet owner or as a trainer," you reasoned. "And I wasn't planning on being one." She kept silent as she watched you. You were fairly certain that's what this was all about, the idea of humans owning Pokemon.

Judging from her unchanging expression and the fact she was walking closer to you told you that your attempts at calming her down have failed. "I'll be honest, I don't like humans. Every now and then I like to daydream of going into one of your towns as a giant and teaching you all a lesson. That will never happen, of course, but it seems fate gave me the next best thing. A little human of my own to play with!"

You stumbled as she walked over you. Her paws were to the either side of you and you had to crane your head right up to see her smirking down at you. As you tried to open your mouth to plead with her all the wind in your lungs was knocked out as a paw bumped into your chest sending you falling back onto the floor. The fall left you dazed and it took you a few seconds to recognized the paw she pushed you with hanging mere centimeters away from your face. All things considered you considered this outcome but the brash treatment still caught you off-guard. "Don't worry, i'll try not to hurt you too much," she teased.

With that the paw rapidly descended onto you and once again the pressure forced the air out your lungs. At your size it was large enough to encompass most of your body and the sheer weight of it rendered most of your struggles useless. Whatever whiffs of cool, damp air you were getting from the cave were replaced with the stifling scent of grass, dust and whatever else was on her pawpads. The paw above you was merely pinning you down and while you wanted to beg for mercy, you couldn't find your voice. Whether or not it would have stopped her was up to debate but right now panic began to course through you as you felt her applying more pressure.

Just as you were beginning to see stars form in your vision, she released that pressure. In a panic you desperately tried to push away at her but only succeeded in trapping your arms between her toes. The Umbreon, clearly enjoying herself, repeatedly pushed you down into the floor. "You like that?" She chided. The dark-type was constantly changing her angle of approach, sometimes dragging you around a little bit or clenching her toes around your limbs. It was a constant barrage of attacks that only relented for a few seconds whenever she felt like she had to change what paw she was to smothering you with. This continued for a while and every minute under felt like an hour.

Eventually your whole body was wet with perspiration from her body heat and your muscles were aching from the abuse, you couldn't even find the strength to mutter a cry for mercy if you wanted to. You soon found yourself submitting to assaults and as minutes ticked by you mentally checked out. So checked out you didn't even realize she wasn't stepping on you anymore. It felt like forever since you smelled the damp air of the cave. Sitting up took a surprising amount of effort and it took you a moment to regain your senses.

Looking up you saw Umbreon sitting on her haunches in front of you but your eyes hadn't readjusted to the golden illumination her rings were producing. The fact that they were flickering darker every few seconds didn't help either.

As your eyes adjusted you saw that Umbreon looked...
113223223.title: Rough-housing

choices: You stick with Umbreon for now, letting her get things off her chest
You want to go back to Sylveon, where it's safe
You pass out before you can answer
1132232233.content:
You looked fearfully up into the gaze of Umbreon, hoping that the torture was over. You tried to stand up from your sitting position, only to grunt in pain as you looked at your left leg. A welt was already starting to form there that made it hard to stand. You didn't think it was broken, but you were going to be bruised and sore for a while. With a silent gasp you fell back onto your butt, trying to scoot away from this titanic beast, when you looked into her eyes again though she looked...a bit surprised as she looked at you. It wasn't like the intense look she had been giving you since she took you into this area of the cavern. Though your vision was dim, you almost felt like you saw her gigantic jaw working, almost like she was about to say something, but the words died on her tongue.

Moments of silence passed before you heard a murmur from her. "What am I doing...? What would Sylveon say...?" She sighed as she looked at you with something you hadn't seen before. You didn't think it was kindness...more like pity. Honestly at this point it was hard to get your brain to connect what was happening. A dark paw started to approach you once again, and you choked out a scream as you tried to crawl away again, the sheer primal terror it brought to you was something you didn't expect. The scream tore away from you on instinct and it burned your already sore chest as it escaped. Umbreon's mouth tried to work again, before she pulled her paw away from you as she laid down on her belly in front of you, encompassing your vision as you panted, unsure of what her next move would be. Your entire body ached and was soaked, either from her perspiration or your own sweat.

"I'm done little guy, i'm not going to hurt you anymore. Promise." She said as you looked into her red eyes. They seemed to be full of regret as you sat in the silence of the cave. "Please come closer...if you can at least. If not then trust me to help, alright?" Umbreon said, trying to coax you. You just sat there in silence, trying to decide what to do as Umbreon sighed, shutting her eyes.

"I know that so far i've been a bit of a jerk to you. I have my...look, I really do hate humans, your kind..." For a second her eyes opened, and a spark of rage flickered, making you flinch back, once again sending a surge of dull pain through your aching body, making you wince, and as she saw this that spark of rage dimmed. "But that isn't fair to you, is it? I know there's good humans out there...few in number maybe, but there...I took out my frustrations on you. I guess that isn't fair." Umbreon said as you gulped. Umbreon and you just looked at each other, she was slowly scooting closer, and you didn't try to get away. Soon you could feel her exhales through her nose as you truly hoped that it was over.

You looked down at your leg as she got closer, the glow from her rings letting you see it in full as it looked quite rough. Your own jaw started to flap a bit as the titanic head got closer and closer. Umbreon could see your face, taking in the full effect of pain and fear that covered your features right now. She once again spoke, her warm breath blowing through you as she did. "I can take you back to Sylveon if you want. It's only fair...I can help you get back on my back and then you can be done dealing with me if you want, at least dealing with me away from Sylveon." She said. It almost looked like she wanted to say something else, though you weren't sure. She was leaving it up to you? Not that you were gonna dare complain to her right now, you weighed the options carefully. Umbreon did seem to be done with the torment, as brutal as it was. Maybe let her say her piece, talk to her? Then again, right now the idea of getting the hell away from her to the obviously nicer eeveelution was a tempting offer.
1132232233.title: Umbreon's remorse

choices: Insist on staying in the cave to rest
11322322331.content:
The Umbreon looked extremely frustrated with herself and showed genuine grief over what she did to you. While the pain all over your body was saying otherwise, you thought that it would be best in the long-term if you stayed with her and try and help her get it off her chest. "Did you... Did you want to talk about it?"

Umbreon looked taken back by your question. "Huh?"

You weren't too well versed in comforting people that were upset let alone a Pokemon many times your size but you tried anyway. "I've heard talking about whatever's upsetting you can help. We're going to be spending a lot of time together, I think, so it might be for the best if we talk about it?"

Struggling to your feet you severely underestimated how sore your legs were. The cold ground was too rough and even though her treatment of you was sending mental signals to avoid anything large, black and furry but you were severely craving something warm and soft to lean against. "What are you doing?" She asked, bewildered at your boldness. You didn't answer but instead shuffled over to her and pressed your back into her fluffy chest.

"So you hate humans because they catch Pokemon?" You asked. Umbreon sighed and you felt yourself being lifted up, the sudden movement making you let out a worried murmur. You soon found yourself nestled between her arm and chest, surrounded by comfortable warmth. From your position you could see she was just staring at the cave wall slowly breathing, she stayed like that for a while as she presumably worked up the courage to talk about her issues.

"Sylveon likes to tell me that Pokemon that are caught by humans actually enjoy their time with them. I don't see how they could, though, It's demeaning! No offense." She vented. She remained silent before you could hear a sniffle above you followed by a long, drawn out sigh. "I don't know why but I'm going to tell you something. I've only ever told Sylveon about this." A deafening silence followed before she continued. "Both my mother and little brother were caught by trainers. A similar thing happened to Sylveon but I guess she has a more positive outlook on life, I guess."

The sound of a wet drop on the stone floor caught your attention, a single damp spot that was reflecting the yellow light in the cavern just below the giant Umbreon's head. You struggled for something to say to cheer her up. "Most of the Pokemon in the town I've seen were very happy. You can actually get in a lot of trouble for mistreating Pokemon in the human world, it's seen as a very bad thing to do and-"

Umbreon cut you off. "I'm just as bad as them, then. I did that to you because I thought it would make me feel better, but it didn't. In the end it just made me feel like the evil version of humans I have in my mind. I'm no worse than them."

"Not going to lie, what you did was pretty rough." You croaked as Umbreon looked down at you with a sad frown. Clearing your throat you continued. "But I think the fact you feel bad about it makes you better than them. You can tell what you did was wrong and I can forgive you for that."

Umbreon looked puzzled. "Y-you do?"

"As long as you don't do anything like that again, yeah."

"I won't, I promise!" For the first time after you've seen her in this funk she smiled at you. "I'm so sorry. I'll make it up to you, I promise!" You could feel another black arm wrap around you as you were tightly hugged against her huge furry chest. Slapping an arm against one of her limbs you begged for release. "Oh, sorry." She chuckled as she relented. "I swear from now on I'm gonna be the best owner ever!"

Now her neck was nuzzling against you. You got the feeling she still wasn't prepared to forgive humanity as a whole yet but you felt fuzzy that you made her at least accept you. She held you in that firm embrace for a while, her body heat giving you a comfort it didn't provide before. Letting her hug you, as if you had a choice, you realized you were incredibly exhausted. Soon that yellow light that painted the cave faded as you fell asleep.

Then you woke, just like that. You weren't sure if you fell asleep for only a moment because of the dark cave interior but it seemed Umbreon was asleep too. Still, you felt incredibly refreshed even if your body was still aching a bit. Stretching and working the cricks out of your back roused the fluffy world around you and soon you could see a pair of happy, drowsy red eyes looking down at you. "What time is it?" You asked.

"No idea," she groggily replied. Carefully sliding you off her body she stood up to her full height and stretched. You could practically hear her muscles groaning as she limbered up above you. "Are you alright to climb up? Sylveon's probably wondering if I ate you or not so we better get back." She half-heartedly joked as she sat down again with her back facing you. Knowing she wasn't as dexterous as Sylveon with her ribbons this was probably the better way to get on top of her. Walking up and grabbing onto her black fur prompted her to slowly rise up and while you felt gravity threaten to take you down she was soon upright.

The walk back to the entrance of the cave felt quicker than you thought and all of a sudden you were beginning to see orange sunlight paint the cave walls rather than Umbreon's glow. "Oh, about time you two resurfaced." A familiar voice called out. Sylveon was looking at Umbreon with a smile but her eyes betrayed she was obviously annoyed. "I waited for you to come up and let me get acquainted with the human but you ended up spending the whole night with him."

"My bad." Umbreon nervously chuckled. The dark-type moved to a corner of the cave and was apparantly searching for something but you couldn't see past her neck what for.

"There's no berries. That was your job yesterday, remember?" Sylveon said before she locked eyes with you. "Anyway, I'm going out to see Alakazam about your whole shrinking ordeal, if you want to come." She was giving you an enthusiastic smile that said that she really wanted you to come. "It would probably just be a quick talk with him and Umbreon has to go out to get food anyway so..."

While she was heavily implying she wanted to spend time with you she still wasn't forcing you. You could insist on spending time with Umbreon gathering food but you felt like that would make Sylveon feel disappointed. She looked really eager to get to know you and was apparently going out her way to discover the reason you were in this situation, after all. It would only be fair to spend time with her after spending most of yesterday with Umbreon despite what happened. Either way, it looks like both of them were going to leave the cave for now.

Who do you go with?
11322322331.title: Talking it out

choices: Alakazam has an idea to grow you then and there
Alakazam has an idea on how to grow you, but it'll take time to prepare
Alakazam has no idea how to help you
113223223311.content:
You looked at Sylveon, who for her part did seem eager to talk to you. Being there with Alakazam would also probably be a good idea, giving it a better idea of what happened from your perspective. "Yeah, i'll go with you Sylveon. I'd like to meet Alakazam myself." You said as Sylveon nodded, a noticeable sheen of excitement in her light blue eyes.

"It's decided then, Umbreon, remember to-"

"I'll keep an eye out for a hondew berry." Umbreon cut her off as Sylveon just smiled towards her roommate. "I really appreciate it. Alright then, i'm gonna grab you now little guy." Sylveon approached Umbreon's back as you looked at the titanic white and pink pokemon. One of her ribbons extended out and gently grabbed you. It wrapped around your chest, in one particularly sore spot that made you inhale sharply, though you hoped neither pokemon noticed, though you did wonder if this topic would be brought to Sylveon's attention at some point.

As you were lifted, Sylveon nodded to you, as you were close to her head. The ribbon holding you then turned and took you towards her back, where she deposited you into her plush white fur.

"Alright then, i'm gonna head out. Don't let Alakazam be weird to him." Umbreon said as she made for the cave entrance. You were left perplexed by her final statement.

"Just what did she mean by that?" You asked as you heard Sylveon's voice from ahead of you. "Oh, Alakazam is a very nice pokemon, he can just be a bit...intense to some. Kinda like Umbreon in a way." Sylveon said cheerfully. A flash of last night entered your head from when she was circling you like a predator before you shook the image away. Umbreon wouldn't do that again...she said she'd be the 'best owner ever'. Though you weren't ready to adopt that kind of terminology quite yet, especially if you could get some answers about this shrinking thing from Alakazam.

After Umbreon left, Sylveon turned her head to try and look at you, a small frown on her face. "Was last night okay?" She asked, almost worried. You hesitated before you nodded. Sylveon tried to look you over, as you looked at yourself. There was no denying the bruises.

You sighed. "I'll fill you in as we move I guess? It isn't bad..." You said as Sylveon nodded, turning her head and heading towards the entrance of the cave. As the wind from the early morning outside touched you, you shivered, reminding you of your current nude status...you laid against Sylveon's fur as much as you could, shivering before one of her ribbons covered you.

"Better?" She asked, having clearly felt and heard you. You nodded, before realizing she couldn't see you. "Yes, much better, thank you." Sylveon nodded happily as she kept moving, her ribbon sheltering you from the cold wind.

"So what exactly happened little guy? With you and Umbreon. You two were gone for a long time, and Umbreon can be rather much." Sylveon's tone was kind, but you thought you heard a tone of suspicion.

You sighed as you looked up to her neck. "Well...I guess Umbreon isn't so keen on us humans, right?" You said nervously. Sylveon stopped walking at this point. "What did she do?" You couldn't see, but Sylveon was frowning, afraid of the answer she'd get.

"At first...I won't lie, yes, I got these bruises from her. She said she was being gentle, and I do think she was holding back, but she wanted to hurt me. Take out her frustrations on me." Feeling the stiff pain from what she did to you as you did. "But she...after it she felt really bad. We talked, and she was really sorry about it. Don't be too mad at her, she told me why she feels that way..." You said, hoping you hadn't caused some sort of rift between these two pokemon.

You couldn't see Sylveon's face, but she did let out a sigh. "She leaps before she thinks a lot of the time. I'm gonna give her a good talking to later." Sylveon said ominously. But she turned to smile at you. "But like I said, ultimately she's not a bad pokemon, if you're worried about it, don't be. Umbreon's done a lot of dumb stuff." Her smile turned into a frown pretty quickly though. "I know she won't do it again, but she needs to make it up to you. And i'm gonna make sure of that." Sylveon then turned her head and started walking again. You sighed with relief, hoping the matter was settled.

The rest of the walk was pretty uneventful, though quite long as you wondered just how big this forest was, or how far away this Alakazam was as you looked up to see early morning was passing, possibly even approaching noon. Sylveon for her part just kept prodding you about your life or the human world, you were happy to answer her, but after a time it grew a bit monotonous. It was the most random stuff too, though you were thankful she wasn't asking TOO many personal things.

It was around the time when you were explaining what a milkshake was that Sylveon stopped.

"Okay little guy, we're here." Sylveon said as her ribbon pulled away from you. You sat up, and Sylveon lowered her head, letting you see past her neck to a waterfall...and in front of it, a meditating Alakazam with rocks circling him.

"Whoa..." You muttered. You'd heard that Alakazam was one of the most powerful and smart psychic pokemon around, and you figured that had you not been as small as you were, you'd still be awed and impressed by him.

"Sir Alakazam, I come with a question." Sylveon said, a rather formal tone considering how she'd been talking to you up until now.

The Alakazam didn't move at first. It just kept meditating with the boulders circling him, after about a minute, you swallowed...Sylveon never moved, nor did the Alakazam. You wondered if you should speak up before you noticed the boulders dropping, one by one. It was when the last one dropped that Alakazam slowly opened his eyes.

"Sylveon. And a human hmm?" Alakazam said. You gulped, it already knew you were there. Before you even had time to blink his towering form was right in front of Sylveon, him eyeing you. He looked like he was scrutinizing you as you almost felt the urge to try and turn tail and run. Not that it'd get you far.

You opted to give a nervous smile and wave, as the Alakazam, without changing a single muscle in his face, lifted a hand up...and waved back?

"This is most curious. I have never seen a human this small before. Or this naked for that matter." Alakazam mused, you blushed as you tried to cover up, though the Alakazam paid no mind.

"Umbreon found him like this yesterday, he says he was just taking a hike when he shrunk, he has no idea how it happened, nor do we. He’s able to understand pokemon now too." Sylveon said. Alakazam's expression grew even more intense as he closed his eyes, clearly thinking on things. "I see...i've sensed odd things going on in the forest of late, but this is well out of the realms of what i'd expect." Alakazam backed off a bit as a psychic aura formed around him.

"Here, I think I can help you." He said. Your heard soared at this. Was he going to grow you!?

His eyes glowed as you felt your skin prickle from the intensity that he was exuding...You felt a grin form on your face as a flash of intense light surrounded you.

You closed your eyes, smiling stupidly before you opened them...only to be greeted by the same intense sight of the towering Alakazam, with you on the titaness that was Sylveon.

"Uh..." You looked down to see...you were in clothes? You had a jacket on too, shoes? It all fit well...you frowned a bit before looking to Alakazam, which made you jump back in fright. He was giving you the most giddy, eager smile you'd seen from any pokemon...you thought ever. "Well? Is it to your satisfaction?" He asked, almost like a child asking for praise. You blinked in surprise before smiling. "Um, yes it is! I had been very cold up until this point with no fur. I really appreciate it!" It wasn't a lie, and having him happy might lead to better things down the line.

Alakazam nodded. "I could tell! No point hiding things from me! You'll find that those clothes are quite durable too! And very easy to clean!" He seemed quite proud of himself. Sylveon raised her head, though with how big Alakazam was in his close proximity you could still see him.

"Sir Alakazam, we do appreciate this, but we were hoping you might have a solution related to his size...maybe?" Sylveon finished the statement unsure of if it would go anywhere as Alakazam adopted a serious expression once more.

"Hmm...that might be more tricky..." He said. You hoped he'd have an answer...
113223223311.title: Visiting Alakazam

choices: "Going someplace nice where we can spend some time together."
"Going to see a friend of mine."
1132232233113.content:
Alakazam paused as he leaned in closer to study you. Staying still you waited as the psychic Pokemon analysed you from an array of different angles, frowning as you heard him hum disapprovingly to himself. "Sorry, but I don't think I have the means of turning you back to normal."

The words were a kick to the stomach. "You can't?"

"I'm afraid not. What I can do, however, is investigate whatever happened to you and try and find a solution that way." He said.

"You will? Thank you!" You exclaimed.The fact this respected Pokemon was going out of his way to help you made you feel honored. Alakazam humbly waved it off.

"It's a puzzle and I'm interested in solving it. I've sensed strange energies and heard tales of odd goings-on all around the forest recently but I'm not sure if it's the work of an exceptionally powerful Pokemon or if its some other phenomena. I looked past it because it was mostly benign but if its starting to produce more severe incidents like this then I can't ignore it. No doubt if I can discover the cause of your shrinking a solution should show itself. Hopefully." He explained.

His words made you optimistic but that last part he added made you feel a tad anxious. There definitely was a possibility that even if he does find the cause he still may not be able to find a way to get you back to normal. He meant nothing by it but it was the truth, you just had to hope he found a solution and live with the possibility that he might not. You gave him a weary smile and thanked him again.

"Can you tell me about what happened?" He asked. "Any little details would be helpful."

"I remember just hiking just like I usually do. I decided to walk off the trail and go deeper into the forest and not long after my vision blurred and I collapsed, waking up later like this. Then Umbreon found me." You explain. Biting your lip you try your best to recall where exactly you collapsed. There were no landmarks, the only thing setting that area apart would be your backpack and even then a Pokemon may have moved it. "I can't remember where It happened. And when Umbreon found me..." You suddenly recall the hot, damp insides of her mouth when she decided a mode of transportation for you and shuddered. "...I couldn't exactly see where we were coming from."

Alakazam tapped a claw on his chin as he took in the information, or rather lack of. "Hmm. Then I'll start the investigation by asking Umbreon about it. I'll find you if I discover something new." The psychic type before you suddenly vanished in an instant making both you and Sylveon jump in fright.

"I hate it when he does that..." She grumbled to herself. Turning her head to you she perked up. "I think that went well. He may have not been able to grow you back but its good he's looking into it, right?"

"Definitely," you agreed. It was reassuring that possibly the most wisest and intelligent Pokemon in the forest was helping you. With that, Sylveon turned around and started walking back the direction you originally came from. You were a little bit relieved that the fairy-type didn't instantly delve back into asking questions about every insignificant detail of human life, instead choosing to cheerfully hum to herself as she walked. Sitting on her back you scooted up till you were by her neck and leaned onto it, reclining in the cool shade the back of her head cast on you.

It was quite cozy sitting on her back listening to her hum. You just sat back in her fur as she leisurely walked and took in the sounds of the forest. You had to admit, despite being shrunken and all the drawbacks it offered you really liked that it gave you an opportunity to relax in the plush fur of a Pokemon like Sylveon. Her fur was so soft and luscious that it actually took away the stress of your situation. One of your friends that had an Arcanine talked about something similar, although this was way more extreme compared to that. You heard a giggle. "Having fun back there?" It took a second to register what she was talking about until it clicked that you were running your hands through her fur without thinking.

You awkwardly laugh it off and stopped. "Oh, sorry." Your face was burning as you blushed.

"You can keep doing it if you want, it feels nice." Sylveon cheerfully said. "I heard humans like doing that to Pokemon. Petting, is it called?"

"Yeah." While you enjoyed the texture of her fur and she gave you the go-ahead you were too embarrassed to continue. You let out a sigh and sat up so you could take in the sights around you as a distraction. The first thing you noticed was that you were on a much different route than the one Sylveon initially took on the way to see Alakazam. The trees were more sparse and there was an abundance of different colored flowers bushes scattered about. There was still a bit of morning dew that hadn't evaporated which made the leaves and flowers shine in the sunlight. In all your time hiking in this forest you never saw a place like this.

"Hey, where are we going?" You ask.

Sylveon stopped and turned her head to the side to look at you. "Huh? Oh, we're..."
1132232233113.title: Alakazam begins investigating

choices: "We're um...I guess closer than friends." Umbreon said blushing
"Oh, we're just friends sharing a cave." Sylveon said
11322322331131.content:
"We're just taking a shortcut home." Sylveon said cheerfully with a smile. You frowned at this. "Why not just take this route in the first place then?" You asked as Sylveon giggled. "I wanted to spend time with you, and get to ask you some questions. You spent all night with Umbreon you know! Besides, I also wanted to give Umbreon a bit of time to herself as well, she's probably hunted for berries and gotten interrogated by Alakazam at this point." Sylveon responded as you watched the world pass by you. You had to admit it was a pretty part of the forest.

"I think the three of us could also stand to explore the forest together after we've eaten, no?" Sylveon said kindly as you thought about this. You did enjoy hiking and taking in nature. This would certainly be that on another level. You smiled to yourself as you put your arms behind your head, leaning against the soft fur of your current companion. "That does sound fun." You admitted to yourself. You were also needing something to get your mind off of the doubts that were taking space in your head. Alakazam wasn't sure if there entirely was a solution for your shrinkage. It was entirely possible you'd be spending the rest of your life at this size...as the pet to pokemon.

At some point you sat up and started to see familiar territory, it seemed Sylveon was getting closer to home when your stomach started to growl. Hunger was starting to rear its ugly head when you realized it had been a long time since you'd eaten anything...or drank anything either. Sylveon looked at you with a smile as you rubbed the back of your head. "So uh...i've never eaten a berry before. Think it'll be okay for humans?" You said, and at that her eyes widened. "Oh...I never even thought of that little guy!...Oh no..." She seemed to be deep in thought as you started to see the cave, and she approached it.

"Don't worry, we'll figure it out, okay?" She said as the sun grew dim and you entered your new home. Sylveon paced about before calling out Umbreon's name.

Silently, the dark type padded out from some corner of the cave as she regarded Sylveon. "Hey there you two, finally back?" She said in a tired tone. You couldn't get a good look at her right now, but she sounded worn out. "Yeah, we took the scenic route. Have good luck on the hunt?" Sylveon asked before Umbreon grinned. "Yeah, got a good haul this time, no hondew berry though. Sorry..." Sylveon frowned at the lack of her favorite berry before giving a carefree smile. "Well, so long as we're stocked up...though we do need to figure out a few things..." Sylveon looked at you before Umbreon padded over to look at you as well. You met her giant red eyes as she blinked down at you. "You got clothes?" She asked before you smiled. "Yeah, Alakazam helped me with that...though he couldn't grow me." You said, before Umbreon smiled down. "Eh, don't worry about that. Worst case scenario you've got us taking care of you. Alakazam grilled me about finding you as well, I told him what I knew and he teleported off to who knows where." Umbreon said as Sylveon took a few steps, causing her to be facing Umbreon eye to eye.

"I also know about what happened last night...Umbreon, I can't believe you-"

"I know! I know..." She tried to get in your view again as she made eye contact. "Look, I really am sorry about last night. It's not something i'm proud of and I don't want it to be what you think of when you see me." Sylveon once again adjusted herself and at this point Umbreon huffed in annoyance at the fairy type.

"Still Umbreon, you need to-"

"Take him around that corner Sylveon." Was all Umbreon said, wearily. You could tell she sounded tired. Sylveon gave Umbreon a suspicious look before you felt yourself moving again, with you now seeing Umbreon as she passed by. The titanic dark type did look tired from what you could tell, and as you rounded the corner, you gasped at what awaited you there.

In it's monolithic, towering glory...there it was.

"My bag!" You shouted in elation as Umbreon padded over.

"It was damn heavy. I don't know what you humans pack in those things or why you think you need them. But I wanted to do something for you...I still feel bad about last night." Umbreon looked down and Sylveon for her part leaned into the dark type, causing you to roll a bit down her fur. You could reach out and touch Umbreon if you wanted right now.

"That's a sweet gesture." Sylveon said smiling as Umbreon nodded. "Thank you so, so much!" You cried out, leaping onto Umbreon's back at this point. Her fur wasn't quite as nice as Sylveon's, but you didn't care right now, you had your stuff back. This also solved the food problem for what would probably be months! At least until some of it expired but considering your size, the stuff in there would last for a while.

"It was my pleasure little guy, told you i'd be the best owner ever." Umbreon said, blushing a bit.

As you watched Umbreon and Sylveon embracing, something connected in your head, and that's when you decided that maybe you should ask.

"So um...Umbreon, Sylveon...what exactly are you two?" You asked as Sylveon eyed you.

"What do you mean?" She asked and you scratched at your head.

"I mean...what are you to each other...you know?" You asked. "Just friends or...?" Sylveon's eyes widened as you gulped.

The cave was silent for what felt like forever before you got a response.
11322322331131.title: Back at the cave

113223223311312.content:
Umbreon nodded in agreement."Mmm, we're good friends."

"We've known each other since we were both Eevees and us Pokemon got to stick together, right?" Sylveon chimed. You recall what Umbreon shared about their parents and managed to piece together that she may be referring to that. In front of you Umbreon began to turn her head to the side so she was looking at you.

"Yep, known each other for a really long time. Chances are we'll go our separate ways when we find our mates but 'till then we're helping each other get by." She paused for a moment as she laughed. "But I think I know what you're asking and let me tell you that we're not shy-"

"Ahum," Sylveon coughed. She was giving Umbreon a stern look but the slight blush showing through the white fur of her cheeks betrayed her. "It's really not that serious a relationship. Anyway, we need to get you some food, don't we?" The fairy-type said to you, apparently eager to change subjects as she turned to move towards the bag, prompting Umbreon to follow suit. You weren't sure if Sylveon was downplaying the scope of their relationship or it really was that casual but you decided to let it go for now. For now, her suggestion of food was sounding fantastic, a fact emphasized by a pain in your empty stomach.

Sylveon stood over the bag and started prodding through it with her ribbons before she turned to you with a confused look. "Um, what does human food look like again?" She hesitantly asked.

"Oh, look for something in a shiny plastic wrapping, it should be kind of rectangular." You explained.

Continuing her prodding she eventually produced a wrapped granola bar. "This?" She asked. You gave her a nod and she tried her best to open it, wrapping her ribbons around the bar and clamping her teeth on the end of the packet before giving it a quick tear.

"That should do it, thank you!" You said as Umbreon lowered herself down. Carefully sliding down her fur you walked over to the bar which, as expected, was relatively quite huge. The small tear was enough for you to reach in and grab some of the bar that had already crumbled off. As you ate you saw that Sylveon also retrieved a plastic water bottle and was attempting to open it. During you walk to Alakazam she asked about it and thought that carrying water like that everywhere was neat. You were about to interject and tell her how to open it when you heard the plastic cap starting to click open. She then poured a small amount into the cap and set the water down, proud at her accomplishment.

"Thanks again." You said, giving them an embarressed chuckle as they both happily watched you eat, their tails wagging enthusiastically behind them. Thankfully they soon decided to go eat their berries and you were left alone with your food. After eating and drinking your fill you hopped up on the still-wrapped segment of the granola bar and waited for the two Eeveelutions. Umbreon was the first of them to finish as you saw her scarf down her small pile of berries although the way she quickly turned and strutted over to you made you think she wanted to get her paws on you before Sylveon.

"Get on, little guy. Sylveon says she wants us all to go exploring today." Umbreon said as she lowered herself down to let you climb up. With you secured on her back the dark-type walked over to Sylveon who had apparently finished her berries too. "Are we all ready to go?"

"Of course!" Sylveon cheered. "We should choose somewhere to go first, though. Last time we picked a random direction to explore we ended up doing walking in circles."

Umbreon nodded. "True. We could take a walk up the mountain a short ways, I heard it has some really cool rock formations and has an amazing view over the whole forest."

"That's uphill, though. We could always just visit the lake?"

"We've been there heaps of times, though."

Sylveon huffed. "Well in all the years we've been here we never explored the other side of it. The waters so nice and clear, too!"

They both stared at each other before they turned to you. It would seem that they both just silently elected you to choose where to explore. Both the options sounded nice, in all your time hiking you never went deep enough into the forest to go up the mountain nor see this lake they were talking about. You could even try suggesting that they pick a random direction to explore again, too. You have started getting used to riding on Pokemon's backs and think you could be able to orientate yourself back to the cave if they went along with it.

Where do you suggest the group goes?
113223223311312.title: Two good friends

choices: A certain pokemon that annoyed her?
A member of one of those criminal pokemon teams!?!?
1132232233113122.content:
You rubbed the back of your head, both of them were placing the choice on you, and you honestly had to admit...seeing the lake sounded interesting. You didn't get to really see something like that often, and you wouldn't mind going for a quick dip in there either, though that part could potentially be hazardous for someone as small as you. Still, you weren't gonna pass the chance up.

"I'd like to see the lake, if that's okay." You said smiling, Sylveon smiled at this too though Umbreon rolled her eyes. You gulped, hoping you hadn't annoyed her, but she smiled a bit after at you and Sylveon as she relented. "Fine, the lake DOES sound nice. I just don't want to run into that jerk..." Umbreon muttered as Sylveon giggled.

"He's not THAT bad, besides, we can always ignore him too." She said, you blinked at them, but decided against prying. "And that aside, we can explore the other side of the lake too! we haven't been there, and we might meet some new faces!" Sylveon said before they turned their attention back to you. "You wouldn't mind meeting other pokemon, right?" She asked before you shrugged. "So long as they're friendly, I guess not..." You said with a bit of trepidation. You trusted these two, but you couldn't just discount the fact that there were some hostile pokemon out there, and that Umbreon herself started out somewhat hostile to you.
