"Yeah, no one's gonna mess with you if i'm around so don't worry." Umbreon said confidently as Sylveon nodded. "You're totally safe with us!"

You smiled at this. "Sure, could be a lot of fun then." It was then that your furry surface started to move as Sylveon and Umbreon started moving towards the cave entrance. You grabbed a fistful of dark fur to orient yourself as Umbreon moved, a bit quicker than you expected when you were out of the cave, with Sylveon bringing up the rear.

"Full speed ahead!" Umbreon cried out as you saw Sylveon giving you what you assumed to be a sympathetic smile as you tried to keep your grip. The world around you was moving way too fast for you to keep up with right now, and you certainly didn't like the idea of falling to the hard ground from this high up.

"Maybe you should slow down a little? You don't want to buck off the little guy, right?" Sylveon said. You immediately noticed things slow down as Umbreon started to keep pace with Sylveon. "Fine fine." She said as you sighed with relief. Umbreon looked back at you. "That wasn't THAT bad, you had fun, right?" She said as you rubbed at your neck. "It was certainly surprising." You said to her and she just frowned. "Fine, i'll keep it slow for you two." She sounded like she was huffing, but you were starting to get the idea that this was just how Umbreon was. As you looked around at the sights, wondering how far the lake was you felt your mind starting to drift to town. 'I wonder if anyone is looking for me?...I kinda doubt it. Curtis is probably pissed...' Your thought drifted to work as you figured your boss was thinking you flaked out, but it wasn't likely you'd suffer repercussions for that anytime soon.

"You alright?" Sylveon broke your concentration as she looked at you. You offered her a smile and waved it off. "Ah, fine, just thinking about town I guess. Work, human junk." You said. "Sounds like junk." You heard Umbreon say and Sylveon glared at her. "Don't be rude like that, this is a big change for him!" She said and again you waved it off. "Nah, Umbreon isn't that far off, I wasn't exactly a social butterfly, kept to myself, did my job, and enjoyed my hobbies, pretty much it. Just wondering if anyone has noticed if i'm gone yet." You said and Sylveon gave you a sad look. "Really?" She said. You failed to see why she was sad though as you shrugged. "Really." Was all you finished. She looked like she wanted to say something else, but didn't.

"Well, you're better off forgetting that crap, you're our pet now, and you don't need to see any other stinking humans." Umbreon said, a little more forcefully than you anticipated. You didn't respond though, your future was up in the air in your mind, but that wasn't something worth thinking about when nothing could be done right now about it. Instead you opted to change the subject.

"Is the lake good to swim in? That sounds refreshing." You asked and Sylveon smiled at this. "Probably, it's a nice day out! Right Umbreon?"

"Yeah, if you want to freeze your furless butt off be my guest." Umbreon smirked, but you just rested on her with your hands behind your back. "I'll just use you as a giant towel when I need to warm up." You said and Umbreon chuckled at this.

"Right, like that'll be possible with my wet fur." Umbreon said. "So you're getting in the lake too?" You asked and she smiled. "Well if we're going to the lake, may as well right?" She said and Sylveon seemed to physically relax now that the mood seemed brighter.

It was only about a 40 minute walk to the lake you noted, and most of that time was filled with Sylveon and Umbreon talking to each other about stuff or pokemon you honestly had nothing to chime in about. This was fine by you as you looked around at the newer parts of the forest. If you'd gained anything here it was an appreciation for new scenery. This forest was pretty nice, and pretty isolated from people too, though you wouldn't be shocked to see some kind of trainer at some point.

"And we're-oh...great." Umbreon sounded annoyed as you looked to see the lake. It was then that you thought you saw the subject of her annoyance. And it was...
1132232233113122.title: To the lake

11322322331131221.content:
The encounter made you slightly nervous. On one hand Sylveon seemed to like this new Pokemon but on the other it was obvious that Umbreon didn't for whatever reason. Either way, it was clear you were going to be meeting him. Umbreon turned to face the Pokemon, inadvertently blocking you from view with her neck as it approached. You did get a good look at him, though.

He was a...
11322322331131221.title: Meeting a new Pokemon

choices: They decline his offer and head right to the lake
113223223311312211.content:
Cream and orange fur, two blue fins on its arms and a yellow flotation device wrapping around its body. It was definitely a Floatzel. Peaking past the black fur of Umbreon's neck you could see him giving an extremely enthusiastic wave before he started walking over. Umbreon groaned. "He's coming over..."

"Come on, he's really not that bad. He's just uh..." Sylveon trailed off as she tried to find the right words. "Affectionate."

"Too affectionate. He's annoying." Umbreon pouted. "And I'm pretty sure I've still got a crick in my back from the time he bear-hugged me after he found out I evolved."

"He was just happy for you. Besides, that was years ago," the fairy-type reasoned. Umbreon just grumbled in response. Peaking past her neck you could see the sea weasel Pokemon was getting close.

"Heeeey!" He called out, arms outstretched. Umbreon suddenly took a few steps back.

"If you touch me i'll bite you." She growled.

The Floatzel's happy face drooped. "Ah..." Composing himself for a moment he turned to Sylveon who invited him for a hug by sitting on her haunches and outstretching her two front paws. Floatzel leaned down and gave her a quick hug and a greeting. "What are you two doing all the way out here? Going for a dip in the lake? The water's really good this time of the year!"

"Maybe. We're just doing some light exploring," Sylveon said. The Floatzel gave her a toothy smile in response.

"That's great! I need to do some more exploration sometime, all I know is the lake. Hey, I got some sweet berries in my cave if you want some?" Floatzel rambled. You could definitely see why Umbreon could see this Pokemon as annoying. He had a lot of energy and it showed as he talked to the two Eeveelutions. From your first impression he did seem nice, though.

"Your cave is under water..." Umbreon grumbled.

"Oh, right. Well anyway if you're heading to the lake you better not take that path right there. Dragonite is washing himself and he seems pretty upset about something so you should probably take a small detour. I thought he was going to attack me!" He said.

"Thanks for telling us." Sylveon nodded. "He has been a bit testy lately. I wonder what's upset him?"

Floatzel softly laughed and he opened his mouth to say more but his eyes wondered over to you sitting on Umbreon's back. As if he was suddenly frozen, he stared at you with his mouth agape before he finally snapped out of it. "What's that?" He questioned.

The group of Pokemon were locked in a brief silence before Umbreon spoke up. "A human."

Floatzel bent down and leaned in close to you, his face dominating your vision. For the first time since you've met him he was acting more calm and composed. "I can see that, but why is it small?"

"We don't know yet. He just shrunk and then Umbreon found him." Sylveon explained.

"Huh," he murmured. You could feel Umbreon tense up as the Floatzel studied you from a variety of different angles. As for you, you weren't sure if you should be worried about this Pokemon or not. Umbreon was clearly feeling cautious about him interacting with you but looking over at Sylveon you saw she was giving you a reassuring smile. "Can I... Can I hold him?" Floatzel asked.

"You can, just be very careful with him." Sylveon said. You were slightly surprised that you weren't given a choice, it seemed she did really trust him to behave. Meanwhile Umbreon was staring daggers at him. Even though she made no move to stop Floatzel from picking you up her face was clearly communicating that she would react violently if he dared to hurt you. You braced yourself as he reached for you with a cream-furred paw and plucked you up off of Umbreon's back. His short stubby fingers wrapped around you and he used another paw to make sure you were safe from falling.

"Wow." Floatzel muttered. His paws were trembling slightly and his expression was fluttering between amazement and nervousness. You were happy that he was at least worried about the prospect of hurting you but it was obvious he was stoked at the fact he was holding a miniature human in his hands. Those two mixes of emotions he was showing told you that he understood the sheer gap in power between the two of you. "I want one." He chuckled.

"Find your own. He's ours." Umbreon stated. Floatzel laughed off the comment and gently placed you back down on her back.

"What, like a pet?" Floatzel asked.

"Yes. He's our pet." She confirmed.

"Huh. I know a lot of Pokemon that would kill to have their own pet human. I wouldn't mind having my own little human, that's for sure!" He laughed as he excitedly fidgeted in place. He turned to Sylveon. "So you're going to see the lake huh? I know a really good spot to take a dip if you want me to show you."

You heard Umbreon quietly groan but she looked to Sylveon to see what she wanted to do. As for yourself, you weren't sure about him. Floatzel was staring at you with a strange look on his face. For whatever reason you think him simply holding you gave him some sort of a rush. Besides that oddity he did come of as being quite nice... Regardless, you waited for Sylveon and Umbreon to come to a decision.
113223223311312211.title: Introducing Floatzel

choices: Floatzel ends up watching over you
Sylveon ends up watching over you
Umbreon ends up watching over you
1132232233113122111.content:
It wasn't long before you saw Sylveon smiling as she looked to Floatzel. "Actually, that does sound quite nice, we'll get to see a new part of the lake, right Umbreon?" She said enthusiastically before Umbreon sighed, and you could feel her tense up below you. "Sure, fine." She said, not sounding all that enthused by it at all. Floatzel took his eyes off of you for a second before flashing a grin.

"Alright then! Trust me, you're gonna love this spot!" He said as he waved the two giant Eeveelutions in a direction and you felt yourself moving again. Floatzel started humming a tune as he was in the lead and Umbreon groaned at this. You couldn't see any of their faces, but you could imagine Umbreon barely suppressing a scowl.

"Try to be nice Umbreon, he's being nice to us." Sylveon gently said as Umbreon grunted. She quietly mumbled something, mostly you figured to Floatzel wouldn't hear, but you didn't catch it. You were wrapped up in your own thoughts when it came to the water weasel...he DID seem nice, and he didn't do anything to you, but something about the way he looked at you felt off. Not necessarily evil or malicious...just off. You frowned as you thought back to what had happened last night, but shook the thoughts. Everything had been fine so far.

"So I haven't seen you two in forever! You should come around and visit more often!" You heard Floatzel cheerfully speak up ahead of you.

"Oh, we could think about it, but we don't explore much around the lake much. Part of why we're here is we wanted to show the little guy the lake, he was curious to see it." Sylveon said casually.

"I wanted to explore the mountains, but these two outvoted me." Umbreon said sounding defeated.

"Sorry..." You muttered before Floatzel stopped.

"Wait...can he understand us?" Floatzel said as you felt him approaching again and looking at you. Umbreon's body language went rigid you felt as he got close and you looked up at him. He was still giving you an odd look.

"Yeah...I can." You said up at him and he opened his mouth in shock. "That's so cool..." He said in awe before clearing his throat. "Well it's great to meet you!" He said in a friendly tone and you smiled up at him. "Nice meeting you Floatzel." You said politely. You mentally felt calmer at this, he was being nothing but nice.

"Great, you've met, now show us this really good spot at the lake." Umbreon said before Sylveon interjected. "Don't be so rude Umbreon...but yes, I am eager to see this spot too!" Sylveon said excitedly as Floatzel smiled. "Alright, alright. We just gotta keep taking this path." He said as you saw him leave your vision to start down the trail again.

You rested your arms behind your head as you relaxed into the dark fur of Umbreon, waiting for your destination. You almost felt yourself frown though, you'd not gotten much exercise because of this shrinking thing, and were starting to feel a little restless as you idly started tapping your leg in impatience. Umbreon didn't seem to notice as you did this at least, but now you were more eager than ever to go swimming and use some pent up energy.

"So little guy, I got a question for ya!" You heard from up ahead, which got your attention.

"You can ignore him if you want." You heard Umbreon say as Floatzel chuckled a bit.

"Oh, don't be such a spoilsport! Just curiosity is all, but why are you so small anyway?" He asked in a relaxed tone and you frowned at this.

"I uh...don't really know Floatzel, it happened recently while I was hiking, I passed out and woke up this small." You said. You didn't feel the need to elaborate on the details more than that, but it seemed to satisfy the guy at least.

"Wow, that must be rough..." He sounded sympathetic.

"We're taking good care of him though, so it all worked out." Umbreon said with a bit of ease in her voice.

"And Alakazam is looking into what happened as well." Sylveon said with a smile.

"Oh, if he's on it then it's only a matter of time!" Floatzel said enthusiastically. You smiled at this, he was a nice enough sort you'd decided.

"Oh hey, we're here! Come on girls! And human dude!" Floatzel rang off enthusiastically as you felt the ground beneath you speed up. Umbreon was going at a quick pace again, though luckily not too fast to buck you around or off. As you sat up you tried to look ahead, but Umbreon's head blocked your view.

"Oh wow, look at that view Umbreon..." You know Sylveon wasn't mocking you, but it kinda felt like it. "Well I can't see..." You muttered before you were lifted up by one of Sylveon's feelers. She smiled at you before raising you to let you see...the lake was gorgeous, with nary a speck of any other living being, no evidence that anyone at all had been there. It seemed to stretch out as far as you could see...though honestly, you didn't consider yourself a good judge on distance right now. The water itself looked inviting as well, clear as could be, you felt like you'd be able to see the very bottom of the lake if you wanted to go out far enough. The area around the lake looked free of sharp rocks or annoying vegetation to trip over.

"Wow, it looks so inviting..." You murmured before you felt yourself being lowered. You found yourself down on the ground this time, forced to look way up at these titanic pokemon. It was then that you felt a rumble as Floatzel dived into the water, causing some tremors for someone of your size.

"Come on in! The water is great!" You heard him call before Sylveon looked down at you. "So who do you want to watch you while we all swim?" She asked and you looked at her confused. "What do you mean? Can't I just break off and swim on my own?" You asked before Umbreon interjected. "You ain't swimming alone, no way. You'd be easy prey for even a stupid magicarp." Umbreon said before you grumbled. You'd kinda wanted some time to yourself, even if what they said made sense. Independence was a luxury you didn't get to have as a 'pet' though you supposed.

"Hey, I can watch him if you want!" You heard Floatzel call out.

"Hey, back off of our human!" Umbreon retorted before looking back at you.

You sighed, this wasn't what you had in mind, but if it at least let you get in the water...
1132232233113122111.title: Going with Floatzel

choices: "Alright, I'll help you. I guess I'll keep you around." she said
"I'll help you, but you gotta earn my help first..." she said
"You're going to make a fine snack!" she said
Before she could speak, a bunch of Sneasel came out...
12.content:
You thought about your chances long and hard, before deciding that staying here wasn't going to restore your size.

Your best shot was to get moving, hoping to find someone to help. Obviously, logic led you to think that no one would be wandering these woods at such dark hour of the day, but then a fainter voice set some hope in you. Hope that someone might be out here camping, and that they were still awake to 'receive' you.

As gladly as someone would ever help a shrunken, naked person...

There was a chance, a very faint one, that you might have found a kind soul that would be willing to help you out.

The sole hope made you place your hands on your shoulders in an attempt to warm yourself up and start walking towards an imprecise direction.

You decided, though, that you didn't have to get too far from your back. Getting lost further in this forest would mean sinking deeper into this mess, and you definitely didn't want anything else to deal with right now.

Each step you took felt heavy, the cold penetrating your skin like a billion tiny pins, though you gritted your teeth and kept going.

Of course, with your reduced size, you didn't get too far from your bag.

About fifteen minutes passed, before you heard a bush rustling.

Looking around, you saw a figure pushing a bush aside to make way for itself.

You stared attentively.

It was undoubtedly a Pokemon, one you could easily recognize. Black fur, red 'feathers' on top of its head and... very sharp claws, as well as sharp clawed feet.

It was a Weavile.

It made sense to find a Pokemon like that in such a cold night, given its nature, though the sight was 'chilling'.

Weavile were known to be very cruel hunters.

You watched as it took a few steps towards a nearby tree and started clawing into the trunk.

After a few moments, it stopped, appearing satisfied with its work.

"There." the creature spoke, sounding vaguely feminine,
"I hope those dorks don't mistake. Like last time."

Okay, this told you two things.

One: the giant was a actually a giantESS.

Two: how in the world could you understand a Pokemon!?

It was incredible! One moment you're hiking in the woods and then - bam! - you're lost, small and able to understand Pokemon! Just what was with this cursed forest!?

You took a few steps back, astounded by this odd turn of events. Then, you saw the Weavile making looking to your bag, which got her attention.

"Hmm? What's this?" she asked to nobody in particular, unaware of your presence.

She strolled over the bag and began examining it.

That's when you had the craziest idea you could ever get: if you could understand the Weavile, then maybe you would be lucky enough for the Weavile to understand you. If you could convince her that you weren't food, and that you needed help, maybe...

Were you seriously considering getting help from a deadly predator? Evidently, you were, because your legs began moving on their own, towards the dark-type giantess.

Before you even knew it, you were back where your bag and your discarded clothes were, by one of the clawed toes of the giantess, who was intently examining your shirt.

"Some human idiot must've dropped these..." you heard her muttering.

This was your occasion.

"Um... hey!" you cried.

Normally, no one would hear you, but as luck may want it, Weavile had a quite sensible hearing. They had to, or they wouldn't be such efficient predators.

So, when the giantess began looking around, you called again,

"Down here!"

The red-eyed Pokemon turned her gaze down at her feet, where she saw...

"Huh?" she squinted, trying to see you better; when she did, those same eyes of hers widened,
"A human?"

You watched in silence, intimidated, as the giant being bent, carefully bringing her clawed hand down, scooping you up as carefully as she could in order not to accidentally gut you.

When you were safely sitting in the middle of her palm, away from the tips of those razor-sharp claws, Weavile brought you closer to examine you.

Yep. You really were a very tiny human...

The weasel smirked.

"Well," she began in a tone that couldn't mean anything good,
"What do we have here?"

"I'm a human!" you replied, maybe a bit louder than you should have.

"I know that, you id- huh?" Weavile abruptly trailed off,
"Did you just answer me?"

"I did."

Now the giantess looked amazed.

"You can understand Pokemon?" she asked slowly.

"Apparently." you replied, feeling slightly calmer,
"Though I'm not sure since I really just met you so far,"

The Weavile squinted.

"Okay human, why are you so small? And how can you understand Pokemon?" she inquired, before adopting a suspicious gaze,
"You're not one of those 'pure-hearted' nimrods that can talk to Pokemon, are you?"

The statement left you a bit uncertain.

"Er... no? I'm not even a trainer," you explained, trying to keep calm,
"I don't know and... I don't know. I don't know why I'm small, nor why we're having this conversation. The only thing I know is... I need help. So, um... could you help me?"

Weavile blinked a few times, as if taken aback by the request.

You guessed you would be too if you were a Pokemon and a human, who notoriously caught Pokemon, asked you for help. But then again, you were no trainer and she had no reason to hold anything against you.

Your thoughts came to an end when you saw the Weavile smirking.
12.title: A dangerous 'savior'

121.content:
The smirk on the Weavile's face didn't linger for too long as she soon replaced it with a friendlier smile.

"Alright. I'll help you," she said you, who were left positively surprised. Whoever said Weavile were cruel? 'Cause this one was pretty nice to you.

"That's awfully nice of y-"

The giantess rose a claw, interrupting you,

"Hold your Rapidash." she said, retrieving her smirk,
"I'll help you alright. I guess I'll keep you around..."

Your relief faded.

"What!?" you exclaimed. Perhaps that rumor about Weavile being cruel wasn't so fake after all...
"I thought you were going to help me for real!"

"And I am, you silly idiot!" she retorted,
"I could've just eaten you, ya know! I'm doing you a favor!"

You didn't see it that way, and tried to oppose.

"I... I don't... I can't..." you mouthed incoherently.

Weavile huffed, having had enough of your complaining.

"Look," she said,
"If you don't want my help, then I guess the alternative is still valid..."

For some reason, her fangs seemed to shine at the mention, causing you to gulp.

Was this Weavile really threatening you into agreeing?

"Well?"

"Yeah, help sounds nice right now." you sarcastically replied, getting the Weavile to smirk.

"Great. Welcome on board, human!" she said, grinning mischievously,
"I'm sure you and I are gonna get alone just fine, even if you're a bit of a dope."

You tried to smile at her words, but all you could manage was a forced smile that didn't really look so convincing.

However, Weavile didn't seem to notice. And, if she noticed, she ignored it.

"Well then, let's get outta here, before the others find me. Wouldn't want them mistaking you for food. Will I be damned if those incompetent Sneasel eat you instead of me." she said, sending shivers running down your back as she began walking.

"Wait." you stopped her, pointing to your bag,
"Please, bring that. There's stuff I'm going to need inside, if you're going to k-k-" you couldn't bring yourself to say it. It took a huge effort to,
"... Keep me."

Weavile looked at the bag, then groaned.

"Sorry, but I gotta go hunt. That thing would only slow me down." she bluntly replied.

"Aw, come on!... Er, I mean, please!" you said, causing the giantess to huff.

"I know you from five minutes and you're already being a pain in my..." she murmured the last part, before saying,
"Fine. Guess it can help me carry you."

"That's a great idea!" you agreed.

Weavile nodded, before lowering the claw you were on inside of one of the empty pockets of your camping bag, securing you inside.

"Happy now?" she said, somewhat annoyed, before adding,
"I'll be hunting for the next hour or so, so... I don't know, think 'bout life or something."

What kind of suggestion was that?

The pocket you were in was closed, before its insides shook as Weavile scooped up the bag and slid it over her shoulders, feeling it heavy on her back, though not that much.

With a sigh, she moved over to a nearby tree, surprised to see that, despite the weight, her speed was pretty much the same.

As for you, feeling your world shaking, you sighed.

This was going to be a long night...

--

You were left trapped in a dark corner of your bag for who knew how long, presumably hours, with the surroundings constantly shaking, tossing you back and forth with the confines of the pocket.

This was not what you had imagined, but you supposed it was better than riding on Weavile's claws, where you would have surely been sliced in half.

The thought was grim enough that you were glad to be in this shaky pocket right now.

Time drew on without a word from your new 'caretaker'. You couldn't even think straight, because you couldn't keep your focus for more than two seconds before a strong motion threw you to another corner of the bag.

But then, it all eventually came to an end.

You felt your lone pocket stopping, before the opening above you opened and light peered in, before it got eclipsed by Weavile's grinning face.

"Sorry about that," she apologized,
"But hunting requires focus. I couldn't talk to you."

"That's okay." you replied as you came out of your own bag, immediately taking notice that the Weavile's claws were covered in what appeared to be-

You looked away, pitying the poor creature that was no longer among the living.

Then, you realized that you were hungry as well.

"Hey, can you do me a favor?" you asked.

"Hm?"

"There's a few snacks in my bag. Can you get them for me? I'm starving." you told.

"Oh. Sure, I guess." she replied, kneeling to open up your bag... at least to try to, because she couldn't figure out how to zip it open.

"Darn thing..." you heard her muttering, before she finally had enough and slashed the upper part of the bag, ripping it open and digging inside, while you watched in silence. If this was the way she treated stuff, then you pitied yourself for how she was going to treat you.

--

After eating your fill, you turned to the dark-type, attempting to strike up a casual conversation,

"So... guess I'm staying then." you said.

Weavile nodded her head.

You looked down a moment, before asking her,

"Why, anyway?"

Weavile began snickering.

"Dude, you're a little human! How many Pokemon can say they got their own shrunken person? How cool is that?" she replied.

You began tapping your fingertips on the floor of the cavern Weavile had brought you in.

"... Wait, 'theirs'? You mean I'm..."

Weavile nodded her head with one, eager motion, excited at the idea, while you weren't really sure you liked to be considered her property. The way things were going, it was pretty clear that you were 'hers'. Her belonging.

The thought was a pretty hard one.

You looked back at the giantess.

"So, what am I to you?" you asked, before noticing her staring at you, perplexed, and adding,
"Like, a pet or... I dunno..."

"Ah. Didn't think about that..." she admitted, before falling into thought, letting the silence fall as well.

You kept staring at her, until she looked back at you and said,
121.title: Property of the Weavile

123.content:
You gasp in terror when you see the Weavile opening her maw. Before you could say anything, she tossed you on her broad tongue and snapped her jaws shut. The Weavile hummed happily as she took in your taste. Looks like humans were on the menu. She tilted her head back and swallowed you down. She traced the bulge in her throat before you fell in her gut. She scampered up a tree and plopped down on a branch. The orange bead on her forehead glowed blue, and her gut grew a good deal bigger. The Weavile chuckled at your hopeless struggles "Squirm all you want, you will just be fat on my ass. But don't feel too bad, humans are my new diet. So go on and gurgle," she informed you. You kick and thrash, your limbs melting and vision going dark.

A few minutes later, the Weavile stood up and looked at her rump with pride. "Right where you belong," she said, giving her plump cheeks a slap before she ran off.
123.title: "You're going to make a fine snack!"...

13.content:
Your brain raced as you pondered what you should have done now. You didn't know how you shrunk, or how you were shrunken, but one thing was clear: you couldn't stay here forever.

You had to find a shelter, it was your only chance to survive through the night. Otherwise, you were either going to be eaten by a fellow pokemon or you were going to die from hypothermia.

The cold was already making you shiver and you didn't see any way to improve your current situation. Getting help seemed an impossible task ahead of you, given that it was nighttime and you were basically in the middle of nowhere.

Maybe you should have just-

A gust of warm wind blew past you, interrupting your train of thought. A pleasant sensation overwhelmed your body... before fear made your heart pound your chest as you stumbled back, startled.

And that was when you turned around, meeting your own gaze in what had to be a gigantic mirror. But... there could be no such thing, not here...

With horror, you realized that the thing you were looking at was your own reflection in the eyes of someone!

The face those eyes belonged to wasn't the one of a human, but the one of a curious pokemon, bent as it regarded your helpless form on the ground.

You felt a knot wrapping around your stomach as you looked up, noticing what pokemon was staring right back at you.
13.title: Spooked from behind

131.content:
Warm air passes over your form again as the Pokémon examines you. You can see your own fearful expression reflected back at you in the mirror like eye.

Next thing you know you are grabbed up and lifted off the ground. Looking down it’s a ways to go if they drop you. They turn you in multiple directions to have a better look at you. You’ve Become dizzy by the time the set you on a rock and step back. Once you get your balance back, you look ahead and see it’s just a normal Pokémon.

Which one is it?
131.title: It was a normal pokemon

Before you could think about that the bunny grabbed you and and put you against it's chest startling you a bit but calming down as you felt the soft fur enjoying the feeling and the bunny started petting the soft paws going across your body

The buneary is immature and lives with her mother and many sisters
The buneary has yet to evolve but has children of her own
1313111.content:
Two furry soft lips between the pokemon's thighs flexed and moved as it bounced, showing a little bit of pink every now and again, You crawled back to your former position and grabbed hold of the fluff and laid there, ruminating on what you just saw.
No wonder that her voive sounded feminine to your ears. This buneary was obviously a female! A blushed and looked away before mentally kicking yourself for letting your curiosity get away from you. At least there's no longer any doubt in your mind as to the sex of your host.
The bunny pokemon bounded through the forest at high speed, leaping over stones and tree roots to get to her destination.
It was surprisingly easy to hold on despite the great amount of jostling, probably because even if you managed to let go you would likely bounce into more fluff. Soon she reached a part of the forest where the growth was particularly thick and little beams of light splashed onto the ground.
Now completely certain that she's no longer being pursued by a predator, her in slowed until it was but a leisurely hop.

Just where is she taking you, anyway?
