13232.content:
For several moments of unbroken silence, all you were able to see was your own reflection in the gigantic blue eyes of the pokemon that was staring back at you, stunned by the sight of what couldn't be any other thing but a shrunken human.

But then, moonlight showered both you and the legendary that was staring at you, allowing you to see it more clearly; the mere sight of it was enough to send you into a state of deep admiration as you recognized the legendary as one of the most rare pokemon of the whole world!

The pokemon in front of you was relatively small, had a slim form covered in clean and well-kept cream-colored fur; its hands were bright red and had three fingers each; its feet had the same color of its hands, but had only two toes and its face showed an adorable pair of huge blue eyes with white pupils, a tiny black nose and a thin mouth with two rather sharp canines poking out of its lips; the legendary was laying on its back as it regarded your small body, so you could notice two wing-like tails at the bottom of its back. And, on top of its head, two big, V shaped ears pointed upwards.

It was Victini, the pokemon who supposedly brought eternal victory to the trainer who was lucky enough to capture it.

And, while you were no trainer, you were lucky enough to meet Victini, whose existence was believed to be a mere myth!

So lost in admiring the sight of the adorable legendary that currently laid belly-down in front of you, you failed to notice its paw snaking up towards you; before you had time to realize it, the ‘little guy’ had you solidly held in its grasp.

Only when the ground came missing under your soles you snapped out of your trance, noticing the Victini moving to stand back up.

Then, the fist that held you was brought up to the face of your new captor as it stared at you from up close, probably trying to decide what were you.

The mere being in the grasp of the fire-type made you feel a lot less cold, but not for this less amazed by the sudden apparition of Victini. As it stood up fully, you had the opportunity to check the front side of the giant; despite its sudden contact with the ground, not a speck of dirt was clinging to its extremely clean fur. The chest-fluff was ruffled, its legs short and stubby.

But what really drew your attention was the thin, pink slit that rested in between the Victini's legs.

You blushed furiously as the realization that this giant was a giantess hit you, but you had no time to think about it.

"Hey, are you a human?"

Instinctively, you looked up as the voice rang in your head for a second more.

But there was no one, aside from the giantess holding you, who was staring at you with a perplexed expression.

"How did you get so small little guy?" the voice said again, and you saw the Victini's lips moving as she spoke, seeming completely uninterested in the attention you had been giving to her nethers.

"Y-You... You talk!" you blurted out in response.

What the heck was going on? How were you able to understand-

"And you're so incredibly small! Like, the tiniest being on this planet! I thought humans were a lot bigger than that, but you look so cute!" the Victini chimed with excitement, her initial confusion completely gone.

"How did you get so small little human?" she repeated you while her feet left the ground, her bottom lifting as well thanks to her tails.

"I... don't know..." you meekly replied, still stunned by the revelation that this legendary was able to speak human language.
"I was just wandering around and I fell asleep all of a sudden, and when I woke up I was like this and-" realization suddenly hit you.

Victini was a legendary. Legendaries were the most powerful beings on the planet. If you managed to get on her good side...

"... I need help." you said, causing the mythical fire-type to cock her head as she stared at you.

"... ‘Help’?" she parroted back,
"Help with what?"

You sighed - were all legendaries so naïve?

"With my size!" you exclaimed while trying to keep calm.

If you ever made the mistake of angering this beast, it was going to be your last one. Hell was going to be a vacation in comparison to what came first.

"... You see how small I am? I wasn't until a few hours ago! I woke up like this and I won't be able to survive if someone doesn't help me. And you're the first one who found me..." you patiently explained.

The Victini's face brightened up.

"Oh, I get it! Help you, hm? Hmm..."

You didn't like the way that ‘Hmm’ sounded, nor the smirk that appeared on her face as she produced it before she quieted down, placing a paw over her mouth.

The time where nothing was said or done drew on, reality came back to you: you were in the paws of a legendary who could do anything to you without you being able to stop her.

She could eat you, stomp you, shove you up her-

As you began reconsidering though, Victini looked back at you, her grin wider than ever.
13232.title: In the paws of Victory

choices: "Just let me rest. I need to sleep on this."
"I guess we can, uh... keep talking? Y'know, get to know one another?"
"Can you get me somewhere else? It's cold out here."
132322.content:
You didn't really know what that smile the legendary was carrying meant for you, but Victini soon cleared that fog,

"Okay buddy, I'm gonna help you!" she exclaimed cheerfully. You could feel your heart fluttering with relief... just before it sank like a rock on the bottom of the sea upon hearing her next sentence,
"Byyyy keeping you with me! Isn't that awesome!?" she continued, eyes sparkling.

The expression you had on your face told everything, 'What?', though Victini didn't seem to pick up on the problem.

"Um, dude? What's wrong?" she asked with sudden concern, noting that you were just staring at her, almost catatonic.

Hearing her voice once more snapped you back to the insane reality you were living in.

"What do you mean what's wrong?" you spoke, feeling a chill running past you before it was dissolved by the warmth emanated by the Victory legendary.
"Why would you want to keep me?"

Victini shrugged with her free arm.

"Well, what else am I supposed to do? You're the one who asked for help." she pointed out.

"I meant - help by growing me, if possible, please." you clarified.

Victini tilted her head.

"How are you supposed to grow things?"

"I don't know!" you yelled out of exasperation, before remembering your position,
"... Aren't you the legendary?"

"Last time I checked." she replied,
"Look, I don't know how to help your - heh - 'little' problem, so that just leaves one option. You figure it out."

It wasn't hard to. She had already spoken what she intended to do with you.

"On second thought, why don't you just put me back down and I'll be on my-"

"Aw, c'mooon, don't be silly! I don't wanna think how you'd end up if I left you on your own! Think about, what if some big mean Pokemon was to find you and you were all alone?"

You had already pondered that possibility. You didn't like it, but being kept by a Pokemon didn't didn't sound very appealing either.

Not hearing any reply, Victini smiled.

"See? You see things my way." she pointed out, as if reading you like an open book,
"Don't you get it? This is a win-win for the both of us!" she exclaimed, rising two fingers to do a silly victory pose. How ironic of her to say such thing.

"Whaddya mean?"

Victini glanced back for a moment, then took flight and hovered a few feet above the ground, closing her hand around you to prevent you from falling to your untimely death.

"Think 'bout it, you'll be safe and I'll make sure you've got everything you need," the twin-tailed giantess explained.

You were basically going to become a pet, you mused, though, as humiliating as it could be, you guessed you could live with that.

However, there was still one thing that troubled you, and it was her side of the deal.

"What about you?" you asked warily,
"What do you get out of helping me?"

Victini's eyes sparkled.

"Ain't that clear? I get super cool, tiny-"

'Pet'.

"... Pal! Oh, this is gonna be sooo cool!"

Huh? 'Pal'?

"... 'Pal'?"

Victini nodded.

"That's right! You're gonna be my little friend!" she repeated, her smile fading as she looked down,
"You never get to do anything fun around here. But now you're here! We get to mess together!"

The smile came back to the face of the long-eared Pokemon giantess as she continued,

"What do ya say?" she asked.

As intimidating as she was right now, this creamy legendary seemed more playful than harmful, which you were really glad for, though you had your doubts what she meant by 'messing', in which she wanted you to have a role.

However, if there was no other solution to your issue, then you should have jumped at the opportunity. Which you did. Getting out of the grasp of potentially deadly Pokemon would be a great improvement already, plus Victini assured she'd take care of you.

At this point, what did you have left to lose.

"Alright." you spoke after a long hesitation,
"I'm in."

Victini's smile widened.

Next thing you knew was that you impacted with a soft, warm wall of creamy fur and the legendary flailing in mid-air out of happiness, gushing about how great this was.

You didn't really cheer up, but guessed that this could've gone much worse. Like her eating you, for example.

After a while of just floating around and smothering you in a hug, Victini finally pulled off and did her victory pose a second time.

"Okay dude, now that's settled," she said, doing a childish twirl around,
"Let's have some fu- oh?"

She interrupted when she saw you just staring at her blankly.

"What's the matter?" she asked, adopting an expression of polite perplexity.

You sighed.

"Look, I appreciate you taking care of me and everything, but I just... I need a minute." you admitted, trying to internalize with everything that had been going on lately.

Just look where a stroll in the woods had brought you.

Victini opened her mouth to speak, but then shut it back up and nodded in understanding.

"It's okay." she said, before getting an idea,
"Hey, maybe you can pick what to do next. Wouldn't that be nice?"

You smiled weakly in appreciation. At least, she was trying to be supportive.

"Thanks." you murmured.

"You're welcome!" she replied cheerfully,
"So tell me, what is it that you want to do?"

You thought for a moment.
132322.title: Victini's win-win situation

132323.content:
You were snapped out when Victini brought you close to her face and licked you. Her blue eyes lit up and she shoved your apparently tasty body into her gob. Her tongue pinned you down and she purred at your taste. She NEEDED to shrink more humans. Despite your best attempts, she took several large gulps, sending you to her gut. Victini belched and patted her belly, her eyes glowing to enlarge her food a bit.

"Sorry, but you are too tasty, enjoy being ass-fat," she said cheerfully. Your body started to steadily melt as her acids started to melt you. She rubbed her squirming belly, your limbs failing and your vision going dark. A few minutes later, she flew off, her rump noticeably bigger.
132323.title: Victini decided that this was an opportunity - ...

132331.content:
You gulped in fear as the giant legendary in front of you kept staring at you, seeming unable to move, probably taken aback by the fact it was staring at a shrunken human no less!

The other way around, your legs seemed paralyzed by a mysterious force which kept you still as you were more than stunned to be staring not at a legendary, but a giant legendary! It looked like a pixie, so it undoubtedly was one of the Guardians of the Lakes!

And finally, as you gathered the courage to better examine its face, you could finally tell who this legendary was.
132331.title: Meet a Guardian

1323312.content:
You stared at the face of the legendary, but couldn't really focus for more than five seconds because of its hand suddenly eclipsing your view; its fingers sank into your sides, sending a shockwave through your body as you were lifted upwards.

In the meantime, the legendary pokemon shifted from its laying position as it slowly stood up, before hovering in mid-air.

It was no surprise, most legendaries could do that, you mused.

Too startled to move, you went back to stare at your captor, finally being able to identify it.

And just the mere sight of it was enough to stun you beyond any describable levels.

Indeed, it was a member of the Guardians of the Lakes; it had golden eyes, a red jewel in the middle of the forehead and a pink head.

It was Mesprit, the Being of Emotion.

You made eye contact with the mythical beast; no words were said, no actions were done, you and the creature were having a conversation with your eyes alone.

It talked to you about endless powers and obnoxious consequences if you ever were dumb enough to make it mad; your eyes expressed intimidation and amazement for being able to even stare at such powerful creature whose mere existence was considered a legend.

And there you were, able to confirm that Mesprit was no myth, but a reality!

The creature regarded your tiny body with an undecipherable look on its face; you decided to do the same and began examining the legendary's body.

Your gaze slowly traveled down from the red jewel to the Mesprit's whole head before you began examining its relatively small body, careful to not miss out even the least important detail.

Despite having just laid belly-down on the dirt, the bluish-grey body of the legendary sparkled clean, you noted. It had two slender arms and paws, one of which was holding you; it had two cute, stubby legs and two tails lazily swinging behind it.

But what really drew your attention weren't the jewels on the creature's tails, it was the odd detail that this giant had a vagina.

You felt the air leaving your lungs as well as a deep blush spreading across your face.

This Mesprit was a female!? How could it be, you always knew that legendaries were supposed to be genderless!

Stunned by the sudden revelation, you failed to noticed the titaness holding you raising her head, having finished her examination with the wise conclusion that she wasn't holding some new, undiscovered bug-type pokemon, but a real, shrunken human.

"Hello there."

"Huh?" you rose your head from the Mesprit's womanhood as a voice pierced the silence like light through darkness.

Instinctively, you looked up at the legendary, feeling extremely embarrassed by your prolonged examination of her nethers.

The pokemon didn't seem to have noticed it though, and if she did, she didn't mind.

"Excuse me, you are a human, am I right?"

You felt amazed once more as you discovered that the voice belonged to the same pokemon that was currently holding you! But... it couldn't be... this Mesprit must have been a trained pokemon and her trainer was somewhere around.

You looked around, but there was no one aside from you and the legendary.

So she did talk to you...

"Y-Yes?" you offered as you looked back at the giant Mesprit.
"I mean, yes, I am a human... despite this size..."

The legend looked bemused.

"May I ask you for what purpose you shrunk yourself to such tiny size, human?" she asked.

"I-I didn't! I was just walking around and I suddenly passed out!" you hastily explained, still quite unable to believe what was going on.

Mesprit nodded as she shifted her position, floating on her back in mid-air, like she was laying down on a bed made of air.

"Go on," she encouraged. Her voice sounded gentle and curious, there was no hint of malice in it.

So, assuming that you could trust this giantess at least for now, you continued,

"Well... there's really nothing to say. When I woke up I was like this! And you found me and... and..."

Realization began crawling inside your mind.

You were alone and helpless in the middle of the woods, where countless pokemon waited for nothing more than to make a delicious little snack out of you before eating an actual meal.

You couldn't hope to get out of this forest alive... unless...

"... And I need help," you finished with the most pitiful face you could muster.

It made sense, you figured. If you were able to convince a legendary, one of the most powerful beings in the world, to protect you, you'd be safe until you found a way to grow back to your original size.

The Mesprit adopted a small smile at your mention.

"Help?" she parroted back with a hint of hilarity in her voice,
"You must be referring to me, little guy,"

You bit your lip, trying to not appear disrespectful towards the Being of Emotion, and nodded your head.

"You're... you're talking to me... you let me explain myself while other pokemon would have simply eaten me with no remorse or pity..." you explained, trying to get on Mesprit's good side

The legendary allowed herself to smirk.

"I wouldn't blame them, you do look pretty tasty, human," she replied.

The color drained from your face as you saw the pink-headed legendary leaning forward; a huge, slick tongue darted out of her mouth as she gave your body a long, wet lick, coating you in a thin layer of saliva.

"And you are!" Mesprit chirped merrily while you felt the sticky saliva rolling down your body.

Held by the legendary, you were unable to clean yourself, but at least the saliva was somewhat warm.

"P-Please..." you begged while Mesprit giggled.

"Well... I'd say you'd be way more useful to me if you were alive..." she mused, looking back at you.

A toothy grin spread across her pink face.

"Tell me, human, what will you give me if I help you like you ask?" she questioned.

"W-What...?" you stuttered breathlessly.

Just what did this legendary want from you? Maybe you should have never even talked to her...

"That's right, we can make a deal. What will you give me if I offer my protection from... well, everything?" Mesprit repeated herself with a grin,
"Or, if you wish, let's say ‘What will you do for me’?"

What other choice did you have but submit to the legendary if you wanted to survive?

Your mouth was faster than your brain,

"Anything."

Mesprit closed one eye.

"Anything you say?" she asked with excitement,
"I think we have a deal then, human: I'll help you out while you do something for me..."

You felt relieved at the pokemon's statement. However...

"W-What do you want me to do...?" you stuttered, fearing the worst.

The excited guardian smirked again as she spoke,
1323312.title: A deal with Mesprit

choices: "Sorry, no clue. But, hey! I'll take care of you!" Mesprit said
"Hmm... I could try to reverse this," Mesprit offered
"I don't know how to help you, but maybe Uxie does..." Mesprit wondered
13233122.content:
"Well, y'know, it's quite..." Mesprit paused to find the right word,
"... rare for us legendaries to do... certain things, understand?"

You didn't, and expressed this by staring at the giantess with a confused expression, wondering what she meant by that sentence.

Mesprit seemed to pick up on this problem and giggled.

"I mean, it's quite rare when we... oh, what the hell, we don't have that kind of fun too often, get it?" she bluntly said, giving up on trying to tease you.

Her words, and the red shade that spread across her cheeks as they left the Mesprit's mouth, sent you into a state of shock.

This legendary wanted to use you for her pleasure!

"Y-You... you want me to-" you couldn't even bring yourself to say it, but the blush that spread throughout your face spoke for you.

Mesprit smirked deviously and nodded repeatedly,

"Yup," she confirmed cheerfully, like this was no big deal,
"You help me with my... ‘issue’, I help you with yours. It's easy, really."

You didn't know whether you were pale or blushing, and you didn't care; you didn't even care if you were naked and fully exposed to the cold, there was no way you were becoming a sex toy for this lustful giantess!

"Ehm..." you spoke after a long hesitation, deciding that the best thing to do was to simply refuse Mesprit's help and back out of the deal.

The protection of a legendary would be pretty great, but you'd rather take risks with a normal pokemon than with this mischievous myth.

"Can you just... put me down and forget about me?" you asked as gently as you could.

Mesprit smirked.

"Heck no! Why would I now? If I let you go, you'll simply get eaten or stepped on, and will I be damned if someone other than me made a snack out of you!" she exclaimed, causing you to pale once more.

If you didn't do as she said...

You gulped in fear, which Mesprit felt: her grin shrank a little bit, becoming an almost reassuring smile.

"No need to be afraid, little human. You just have one thing to do, and you'll find I can be quite generous when I'm satisfied. Of course," she said, her tongue poking out of her mouth and slowly sliding across her lips,
"I'll be quite displeased if you turn down my offer."

The threat was clear, and so was the choice you were given.

Either you pleasured this legendary or you got eaten for refusing.

Your choice was obvious.

"Okay." you blurted out after taking a deep breath,
"Okay I'll do it. I'll pleasure you."

"Splendid." Mesprit replied with a smirk.

Warm and blue became your world as she pushed you against her body, before focusing on your bag and lifting it with Psychic.

Before you could question her, the legendary started flying deeper into the forest at supersonic speed, causing you to feel nauseous, the wind stinging your face like a thousand pins.

The giantess flew through the woods for what seemed an eternity, before she stopped in front of a thin opening in a stone wall.

A cavern.

"This'll have to do." she muttered to herself as she flew inside, dropping your bag hovering into a corner, sitting down while releasing you from her embrace.

It was much warmer in here than outside, you noted, though you were still naked: if you didn't find a source of heat soon, you weren't going to live to see the sunrising.

"Now it's your turn, human," the pink-headed giantess said, her paws moving as she let you down on the stone floor, right in front of her short, stubby legs.

You watched with anxiety as the two giant feet and legs spread, revealing a thin slit on Mesprit's skin.

You blushed massively at your second glance of what was basically a second cavern for you, but Mesprit didn't seem to mind.

"I'll leave this up to you, human, let's see how well you can do~" she chimed.

You filled, but approached the towering sex, finding that at least it was much warmer near the hot flesh, which was already dripping with anticipation.

Embarrassed and afraid, you gingerly extended a arm forward, your fingers touching the hot skin and causing the giantess it belonged to to wince.

Your second hand joined the first one as you began rubbing the towering womanhood from the outside, causing its owner to moan.

"Yeeees~" she moaned, her eyes closed, her cheeks red and her tails fidgeting.

You felt humiliated, forced pleasure this legendary in order to survive.

But what other choice did you have?

You started speeding up, getting a bit of the inner flesh too, and you kept this up.

Mesprit groaned, her groin quivering under your hands as it grew as hard as a rock, her insides squeezing your hands pretty hard.

The giantess let out all kinds of sounds and incomprehensible mutterings while you stroke and scratched her vagina.

She let out a sharp moan, suggesting that she was close.

Feeling a bit more courageous, you thrusted your whole arms up to your shoulders inside of the legendary, causing her to scream from the sudden insertion; at the same time, you also caused her insides to rumble.

Before you could pull out, a wave of white liquid came out of Mesprit, hitting you and washing you away from the pixie, who leaned back against the cave's stone wall, panting from such amount of pleasure.

"W-Wow..." she stammered, never having recovered after such orgasm,
"Didn't think you'd give y-yourself to me l-like that, h-human,"

Your body was enveloped in blue light as a psychic tug lifted you and brought you to the arms of the pixie giantess, who embraced you without caring you were still covered in her juices.

"You did well, human," she complimented, her cheeks flared up,
"And now, it's my turn to honor our deal: I'll help you."

Despite what you just did, your embarrassment and humiliation waned instantly.

"Y-You're going to help me grow back to my size?" you bluntly asked.

Mesprit looked perplexed.

"Well..." she began,
"I don't quite know how you shrink, so figuring it out could be quite complicated..."

Your newfound confidence faltered.

"B-But... you can try, no? I did what you wanted!" you exclaimed.

"Hmm..." Mesprit replied, deep in thought as she tried to figure this out.

You did help her after all.
13233122.title: Sealing a deal

choices: Try Drawing From Her Own Power To Reverse It
Try To Track The Energy Signature That Shrank You
Try To Take You To Trustworthy Humans Who Can Help
132331222.content:
"Hmm… I could try to reverse this," Mesprit offered. At that you felt a massive weight lifted from your heart, being so very grateful that the lake guardian was willing to help you. The legendary pokemon detected this change of emotions and made a face at you—almost pouting. "Come now—I did say that I would help you if you helped me. I would never take advantage of you being so small to get what I want without giving you something in return; I am a pokemon of my word through and through." Of course Mesprit was; you really were worrying for nothing, and with that you gave the pokemon a relieved smile.
         "Bear in mind, this may not be an easy task. If you do not know what it was that had reduced your size to what it is now, that limits our ability to undo this predicament." It was almost amazing how Mesprit went from her haze of ecstatic afterglow to laser focused on the task in a heartbeat. "There are three options I can see right now that could easily fix this mess: the first is that I myself will study your body and use what powers I can to grow you back into a safe size at least until growing you back to your original mass is possible, the second is that I scan your form to look for any remaining traces of the energy that had shrank you down and track down the perpetrator to see if they can undo it, and third is that I can instead bring you to a human who is trustworthy enough and knowledgeable enough to grow you back to normal. Mind you, we do not need only settle for one solution—we should try all three in any order you wish to try first, and fall back on the other two methods if one does not work. If nothing works, well, I will have to request Uxie's and Azelf's aid as well."
         It was nice to see that Mesprit already had some of her options narrowed down and was willing to get some outside help if need be, so now you only need worry about which method you wanted to employ first. A part of you wanted to go after whatever had shrunk you down first before trying the other two methods, though they were not without merit either, especially of the culprit behind your shrinking had effectively flown under the radar for good.
         "We need not start right away," Mesprit spoke. "After all, you must be exhausted from pleasuring me no doubt, so if you need to we will rest for the day and begin our endeavors in the morrow." She had a point, and truth be told you honestly weren't in any mood to really go out anywhere, so first thing's first was to get some shut eye. Still, it helped if you figured out what it was you wanted to do the next day so you both would have adequate time to prepare. So, with that you decided that Mesprit should…
132331222.title: "Hmm…I could try reversing this," Mesprit offered.

choices: Uxie knew how to grow you back up!
Uxie was clueless. Looks like you were stuck like this...
132331223.content:
Mesprit's gaze returned to you, but the only response she offered was a shrug with her free arm.

"I'm sorry, I have no idea how to grow you back, human," she said you; immediately, a great resignation, mixed with sadness, stroke her senses.

"Hey, no need to be sad now!" Mesprit spoke encouragingly, her voice adopting a very cheerful tone.

You meekly looked up - of course she'd be cheerful after what you just did to her.

"I'm small," you began,
"I'm lost. I'm helpless. I'm naked, and I nearly just died. How can I not be sad?"

Mesprit giggled.

"I'll tell you how." she said.

Your eyes shut open, a wide grin randomly crawling across your face as your desperation faded away, a sudden happiness replacing it; heck, you felt like you could start to sing!

"Much better, don't you think?" Mesprit's voice rang cheerfully, causing you to look up at her.

"W-What is going on?" you asked in a surprised, though unnaturally happy tone.

"Just a little fix to your gloomy mood," the legendary replied, before letting go of you, leaving you flabbergasted.

What the hell did just happen?

"And anyway, you may want to cheer up for real, my tiny friend. I don't know how to grow you back, but I know someone who could have the answer to this situation of yours." Mesprit spoke with pride, causing your heart to leap with hope.

"W-What?" you stuttered,
"Really?"

"Yup - my sister Uxie can surely find a way to help you out." the giantess replied.

You gulped.

"What are you waiting for then?" you asked,
"Can you take me to your sister?"

Mesprit giggled.

"See? Your mood is improving already!" she pointed out, before adopting a slightly more serious expression,
"But it's kinda the middle of the night, human, and I don't think you're in any condition to travel. Not with the cold outside." Mesprit continued, before yawning,
"Not to mention I'd like some rest right now... and I'm sure you need it too,"

Your expression dropped once more, but you couldn't help but think that the giant pixie was right.

The cold almost got you killed earlier, and right now you had no intention of getting out of this cave; not that it was what you'd call a warm place, but it was surely warmer than the outside was.

You sighed in resignation.

"When...?"

"I'll take you to her in the morning," Mesprit replied, offering a sympathetic smile, only to then yawn again,
"But as for now... sleep well, human..."

Down went your world as the pixie laid down onto the stone floor of the cavern with you still on her paw; your perch tilted, causing you to slide off her hand and fall down, landing on a bouncy landscape of blue that was the chest of the legendary.

"H-Hey-" you tried to protest out of embarrassment, but the same hand that held you shortly ago came down on you, pinning you down to Mesprit's chest; her other hand joined in the embrace too.

"I-I-" you cut yourself off with a deep yawn; your perch was soft and warm, the grasp around you gentle and the sounds coming from within Mesprit soothing.

Your eyelids growing heavy, you looked up at the giantess, discovering her smiling down at you.

The last things you saw before your eyes closed good were the legendary's own, yellow eyes, briefly shining through your hazy mind before everything faded away along with your consciousness.

--

Morning came and the light of the dawn slowly enlightened the skies, letting the moon take its leave.

A small gust of wind penetrated the cave you and your legendary protector resided in, causing you to shiver in your sleep while also causing the pixie holding you to wake up.

Slowly, two golden eyes opened as Mesprit yawned drowsily, before casually glancing down... discovering that she was holding onto what appeared to be a very very tiny human.

The giantess looked bewildered at first, but almost immediately remembered of you and smiled.

"Wake up, human. We have a long trip ahead of us..." she spoke lowly while she delicately shook you, like she was dealing with a really fragile porcelain doll.

The voice of Mesprit and the gentle rocking had the effect of interrupting your sleep.

Your eyes opened as you glanced around, trying to spot the cause of the foreign voice, which you soon discovered to belong to a certain giant pokemon.

For a second, you looked confused, but your mind slowly began flashing images of the events that occurred last night.

"Oh..." you said, blushing vaguely at the memory of you pleasuring the giant Mesprit,
"Hello..."

"Hope you don't mind traveling, because we have quite the flight to make to find Uxie." the giantess replied cheerfully.

The mere idea sent a shiver running down your spine; if, for any reason, you fell off, you'd be doomed... or not? Certain insects like ants survived falls from great heights, maybe you could too...?

It didn't matter, you told yourself, if you could get your size back.

"Yeah, let's go." you said, feeling wide awake all of a sudden.

"Up and running already, huh? I like it..." Mesprit chimed with a grin while the paw holding you rose up in the air; carefully, the pixie placed you on top of her head.

"Make sure you hang on tight." Mesprit instructed.

You saw nothing you could hold onto, so you hastily laid belly-down and hugged the smooth ‘ground’ while Mesprit rose farther up in the air and began her flight.

--

Only after endless hours of boring flight, Mesprit seemed to slow down; when she took off, it was dawn. Now, it was full morning and the warm sunlight showered your naked body upon the giantess's head.

Opposite to what you were feeling last night in the grip of cold, this sensation was actually nice.

"Are we there yet?" you asked for what had to be the twelfth time, lightly tapping at Mesprit's skull.

"Aaand..." the legendary giggled,
"Yes!"

You noted your giant host swiftly hovering down, towards... a lake? It made sense, you thought, after all she was called one of the Lake Guardians.

You wondered why she was in a forest in the first place; whatever reason had brought her there, you mused, had saved you... even if it meant doing awkward things...

Finally, Mesprit halted above the water of the lake and shot a smile at her own reflection; you could see yours too, a tiny insect clinging to the guardian's head, a little ant climbing the great giantess while she merrily let you.

You shook such line of thinking off.

"So? Where's-"

"Give it time." Mesprit interrupted while bringing a paw to her head, snatching you up to bring you down at chest level,
"And hope that Uxie can actually fix you."

You felt a knot tying around your heart, you didn't think of what'd happen if this ‘Uxie’ couldn't help you!

"A-And... what if she can't...?" you timidly stammered, causing Mesprit to smile brightly,
"I'm still here, no? I'll take care of your cute little behind."

You flushed red, but Mesprit ignored the sudden embarrassment that stroke her to focus on something behind you; hearing some water splashing, you too turned around, taking notice of something odd.

A sphere of water was splitting from the lake itself and was now hovering in mid-air.

And then, it bursted, droplets of water were sent flying everywhere, leading you to cover your eyes for a second.

"Mesprit?" a feminine voice spoke,
"What are you doing here?"

You opened your eyes and looked forward, noticing a creature nearly identical to Mesprit, but with a yellow, round head. Also, her eyes were shut.

Apparently, the creature had noticed you as well, because she was staring right back at you in surprise.

"W-Wha...?"

"And that's why I'm here, sis." Mesprit explained,
"This poor lost human has... randomly... shrunken down, and he needs help."

Uxie's head rose as she seemingly stared at Mesprit.

"And where did you even pick up a tiny human?" she wondered.

"The woods around my lake."

So that's where that unknown part of the woods led, you mused, and it also explained why Mesprit was there.

Maybe... there was some sort of curse around the lake that shrunk down any intruder? You discarded the idea, Mesprit would have known then.

Your train of thought was interrupted as you felt yourself moving; you looked up, only to notice Mesprit's paws placing you into Uxie's.

"So you're saying you have no clue about how to help him and want me to do it?" the yellow-headed pixie spoke.

"Yup." Mesprit confirmed,
"You definitely know how to fix him, don't you sis?"

"Why would you want to help a human in the first place?" Uxie retorted, causing a blush to spread across Mesprit's cheeks.

"... I have my reasons."

Uxie sighed and lowered her head, examining you. It was utterly weird, her eyes were closed but it felt like her gaze was piercing those shut eyelids of hers.

You gulped, intimidated.

"Hmm..."
132331223.title: Mesprit's sister

choices: "Of course, I shall aid you, human." Uxie replied, convinced
"I don't think I'm the one that can help you, human." Uxie said sorrowfully
1323313.content:
The giant pixie in front of you had a yellow face and a round head, a red jewel in the middle of its forehead, right above its golden eyes, which had been reflecting you for a split second before its yellow eyelids fell into place while you sighed in relief, remembering what power this creature held: erasing the memories of those who looked at it straight in the eye.

This one legendary was called Uxie, the Being of Knowledge.

You didn't have further time to ‘admire the view’ though, because its paw suddenly darted forward, grabbing a hold of you before you could even think of reacting.

The pixie then shifted position as it stood up on its short, stubby legs. Your gaze simply couldn't help but travel downwards as you looked at the pokemon, taking in every detail to make sure this wasn't some kind of trick being pulled by your mind.

It couldn't be, the grip of Uxie was quite real, as it was the hand holding you, as it was its body, tails, womanhood and-

... Womanhood?

Your gaze lingered in between the legendary's legs, where a thin, pink, slightly damp slit rested. You were dumbstruck, weren't all legendaries genderless? Of course, there were a few exceptions such as Latios, Latias or Cresselia, but-

The giantess holding you cleared her throat, causing your gaze to travel back at her on its own.

Her closed eyes seemed to be staring right down you as she spoke,

"Well, isn't this utterly singular. A human whose size is incredibly reduced," she said,
"Your kind is bigger than this, aren't they? So I must assume that you shrunk down to this size."

Her voice sounded monotone, but you nodded anyway despite the fact you were having a hard time following the pixie.

A timid sentence escaped your lips,

"Please... don't hurt me..." you squeaked.

Uxie cocked her head.

"Now now, no reason to be afraid. I would gain nothing by causing you any harm, human," she spoke soothingly as a gentle smile appeared on her face.
"I just want to ask you a few questions, if that's alright."

It didn't seem like you had any other choice, so you timidly nodded.

"O-Okay... I'll-" you abruptly interrupted yourself, a thick cloud of vapor escaping your mouth.

During the whole conversation, the cold never ceased to penetrate your body, like countless invisible pins.

Lost in fear, you had forgotten about it, and apparently Uxie didn't even notice it.

At least until now, when you were about to freeze to death.

The jaw of the guardian hung open as you began whispering for her help, your vocal chords having shut down all of a sudden.

The giantess stared at you, seeming to be pondering her choices while trying to process the fact that you were dying in her paws.

"Okay, keep calm, I know what to do." she spoke, but you weren't really listening anymore.

So cold...

Your vision grew blurry, your body felt weightless (as it probably was anyway).

Was this it? Were you dying?

You couldn't-

A wave of heat spread through your body as you opened your eyes, noticing Uxie pressing you against herself with both paws, her bodily heat transferring to you as she did.

But it simply wasn't enough.

Your eyes closed back up.

Everything became dark as your consciousness faded.

Uxie took notice of that.

"Damn..." she mumbled as she released you, bringing her gigantic head to your small body.

A sliver of relief entered her: your heart was still working. There was still hope to save this human!

Hastily, Uxie lifted her head from you; without even thinking, she shoved your whole entirety inside of her mouth, past her teeth and onto her tongue, her lips falling back in place immediately after.

‘Should be enough to keep him alive...’ she thought, careful to not open her mouth for any reason. Any breath of the cold air could be lethal to you right now.

With the major problem solved, Uxie looked around, noticing your abandoned clothes and bag, now impossibly big for you and still quite large to her.

With Psychic, the pixie quickly gathered all of your belongings and wandered off into the forest.

--

You didn't know how to feel.

You felt weightless, but no longer cold like you had been before.

Were you dead?

Was this how death was like? Because it wasn't as bad as they said, aside from your back being placed on a hard surface, though something soft and warm was upon you.

Slowly, you began opening your eyes, mentally bracing yourself for what they were going to met with.

Everything was blurry and... yellow?

"H-Huh...?" you whispered as your vision began clearing a bit, revealing the face of the Uxie you met before. So... that wasn't some sick fever dream, you really risked dying.

Perhaps you were dead for real and this in front of you was the spirit of the legendary, you had heard her spirit could split from her body.

Seeing you awake caused Uxie to smile.

"Am I... alive?" you dumbly asked.

"You wasted a question, human," the pixie replied, though her smile remained,
"... But you were extremely close to your grave. I-" Uxie trailed off and blushed, recalling how she placed a naked human inside her mouth without thinking.

"... Brought you here."

For the first time since your awakening, you took a moment to look around: you were in a cave, roughly wrapped up in some sort of fabric.

You recognized it as the sleeve of the shirt you were wearing before your mysterious shrinking happened. Looking elsewhere, you spotted your bag laying in a corner. Sunlight crept inside the cavern, and you discovered that you were laying on a rock.

Your gaze went back to Uxie.

"You... saved me." you muttered, your cheeks flaring up.
"... Thank you."

The giantess smiled.

"Easy there, you need to rest. And eat something, too, so I don't think you'll mind if I took something from your bag for you to consume." she said while a bar of chocolate you had brought levitated closer to you.

A few squares missed from it, suggesting that Uxie had her taste of it.

With some effort, you removed the sleeve of your shirt from your naked body and inched closer to the food, giving it a few bites.

"Now, may I ask you something? How did you get in such precarious size? I mean, there are pokemon that live perfectly with it, but you humans seem to lack the capability to survive with such height." she declared smugly, though keeping a gentle smile.

Given how she was the reason of you being still alive right now, you weren't able to feel mad for her comment.

"I really don't know..." you replied as you brought a hand to your forehead, feeling it damp under your palm.

"I was just wandering around, y'know, a break from the city and stress, but I... randomly fell asleep. When I woke up I was like this, and you were there and-" you stopped in mid-sentence, lacking courage to finish it.

Uxie nodded.

"Seems a complicated situation." she admitted.

"Can you help me?" you suddenly asked.

Uxie cocked her head.

"If you are referring to your utterly mysterious shrinkage, I don't know about it. My apologies." she bluntly stated, and you felt your heart sinking.

"B-But... didn't you make knowledge?" you inquired, causing the pixie to blush.

"Of course. That means I'm smarter than most creatures and - forgive me - you. But I lack enough information to tell how you ended up in such predicament."

Again, you were having a hard time following her, but at least you got the gist of her speech: she didn't know how to help you.

You sighed.

"Well... can you... keep me with you at least?" you asked again, causing the legendary to adopt a thoughtful expression.

She hovered backwards.

"Keep you with me?" she parroted back,
"I'll have you know, human, this cave is not where I reside. I'd have to bring you along if I did."

"To a lake, right?" you asked, and she smiled at you. It made sense.
"It doesn't matter, I need someone to watch over me. It's like you said..." you adopted the most pitiful expression you could muster,

"I can't survive like this."
1323313.title: A hasty rescue

choices: "We're going right now, I need to return to my lake."
"You're in no condition to move, we'll go back in a couple days. You need rest."
13233131.content:
Uxie pondered her decision long and hard. Could she really take this random human under her care as much as intriguing his situation was?

She didn't notice any of those bi-colored spheres his kind threw at hers to capture pokemon when she searched for food in his bag, but for what she knew, he could easily be a trainer.

Though he did mention that he was here because of just ‘a break from city and stress’, didn't pokemon trainers usually travel?

If this little guy wasn't a trainer, did she have the heart to leave him by himself?

"Human," the pixie spoke after a while of being deep in thought, startling you; her voice seemed to echo around in the whole cave.

"I have taken a decision, but I'd like to know something before telling you." she said.

"Y-Yeah?" you replied, perplexed. What did this pixie want now?

Uxie hovered close to the rock that had been your bed for the night; once again, you got that weird feeling of being observed despite her eyelids being sealed.

"Your kind captures and makes pokemon battle," she started.

"Hey, you're getting the wrong idea!" you spoke up, maybe a bit too loudly,
"Alright, my kind captures pokemon, but a lot of times they bond and-" Uxie interrupted.

"You're the one getting the wrong idea. I don't hold any grudges against humans, proof of it is that I saved you. I know most of you aren't bad, but it's also true that some people are really foolish. But- that's not the point," Uxie abruptly interrupted herself,
"We are talking about you. I want to know if you're a trainer or not."

You remained silent for a couple moments; a small breeze blew inside the cave, causing you to shiver slightly.

"... No?" you hesitated.

Uxie cocked her head in a very familiar manner.

"Is that a lie?" she asked.

"No. I'm not a trainer. I don't ‘make pokemon battle’ or stuff like that. How can that influence your decision?" you asked while standing up, only to immediately sit back down: your legs felt like ice sculptures.

For the first time since this conversation started, Uxie smiled.

"I have to be sure. I'm a guardian, I can't risk being captured by your kind. Who would protect my lake if I were to leave it to follow a human? What kind of guardian would I be then?" she replied with a hint of proudness in her voice.

You remained silent, suddenly having taken a lot more interest in your really cold legs.

Uxie's smile grew wider as she moved forward, her paw descending towards you as her fingers sank into your sides before the whole hand lifted you up.

"But if you're really not a trainer, human, then I'll be more than willing to help you out." she continued, causing you to become quite flustered.

"You have to believe me, I have never captured a pokemon before! Sure, I saw quite a lot of them, but I never felt the need to catch them!" you cried.

Uxie giggled softly.

"Now now little human, there's no need to be so agitated. I believe you," she said, her words seeming to cause your whole body, soul and mind to let out one massive sigh of relief, which escaped through your open mouth.

Uxie watched you, her smile still wide on her face.

"Does that mean... does that mean you'll help me?" you asked.

"Why, certainly. I said it, you said it, you can't survive in such rough situation. And I won't allow that," Uxie blushed,
"The duty of a guardian isn't just protecting the lake, in my case, but also living beings from danger. And you, my unfortunate friend, are in great danger, like you had been just last night. I'll keep you safe and fed until we - I - manage to figure out a way to reverse your shrinking."

You smiled at the giantess while your cheeks flared up.

"Thank you." you replied in a whisper.

In response, the pixie brought her other paw up to you and grasped you more firmly, before moving you towards her chest.

You found yourself being embraced by the giantess. You felt like you were going on fire, but the hug felt really nice.

At least for the time being, you were safe from most dangers since you were under the protection of a legendary.

Those pokemon were supposed to hold powers with no bounds despite the sizes. Even the most small legendaries could erase mountains with just a mere glance if they only wanted to.

Slowly, Uxie broke the hug and gently lowered you back to your previous perch on the rock.

The bar of chocolate you barely left a mark on earlier levitated back up to your mouth.

"Here, eat some more, you need all the strength possible right now."

You gave the chocolate a few other bites, your teeth barely leaving any visible trace on a single square.

That only gave you an idea of how pathetically small you were.

"Hey Uxie," you called as you pulled back from your ‘meal’,
"You mentioned you've got a lake to protect, no?"

"Correct."

"And you've got to return to it... am I coming along?" you asked, causing the giantess to giggle.

"Silly human, what did I just say? Yes." she replied.

You flushed red.

"When... when are we going?"

This one question took the pixie aback; but she quickly pulled herself together and replied,
13233131.title: The mercy of a guardian

132331312.content:
"... I don't think you are in any condition to move right now, let alone travel." the yellow-headed pixie declared, hovering backwards a bit.

You tried to rise from your perch, putting your elbow down on the rock to help yourself up.

"Hey, I'm feeling better now," you retorted,
"I'm fine, I can handle traveling... I think..."

Uxie's expression didn't change.

"You've narrowly missed your death just last night, human," she bluntly said, fluttering forward and sitting down next to where you were laying,
"You need a lot of rest for the time being."

You remained silent and stared at the giantess, feeling a chill crawl down your spine: those closed eyes of hers seemed to pierce the eyelids, and you as well.

You wondered how she was able to see.

"... Also," Uxie continued,
"The weather around my lake is very frigid. I don't think you'd be able to survive as you are now."

A blush spread through her face as she spoke these words, leading you to believe she was referring to your nudity.

"What?" you asked,
"Then what are we gonna do? If I'm going back with you..."

Uxie offered a small smile.

"For now, you'll just rest in here. We will be staying over for a few days, until your condition improves. Then, we will go to my lake. There, you shall be under my care until we manage to figure out your situation." she explained, extending a paw forward.

To your surprise, a single, tiny finger came down to your head and began running your hair gently.

"Well... thanks I guess..." you replied, smiling at the giant guardian,
"I don't know how I'll ever be able to repay you..."

Uxie blushed, but offered a timid smile.

"There is no need, really." she replied kindly.

Silence fell in between you and the giant pokemon after her latest statement, and it lasted for a few minutes, before Uxie broke it, a pensive look on her face; a thought came to her mind, a thought about how she could take your offer. When would she get the chance to meet another human this small again? It certainly brought some... advantages, and this seemed a nice guy, too,

"... Actually, I'd like to take your offer, if it's not a problem," she suddenly said,
"... There would be one thing you could do for me,"

Despite her flustered behavior, you gave a confident grin.

"You saved my life," you began, feeling enough energy in your legs to get free of your shirt, get back on your feet and approach the titaness,
"... And you're saying you'll take care of me. That's very kind, and it's only fair I do something in return. I'll do anything... anything I can do while like this, of course."

Uxie's fingertips clasped together and her head moved downwards.

"You certainly can. And if you're really sure..." she muttered under her breath, though you were able to understand thanks your more sensible hearing.

"Of course" you replied,
"What do you want me to do?"

Uxie's shown to be very kind so far, she couldn't make any weird requests, no?

... But then, why couldn't you shake off the feeling that something was off about her...?

Upon hearing your affirmative response, Uxie's blush deepened, and her mouth let a long sigh of embarrassment escape.

"Very well, human, you may consider this as a way to pay me back for my aid. A condition, if you prefer," she said.

Your smile waned. The statement left you very perplexed.

"A-A... a condition?" you stuttered,
"Didn't you say you were going to take care of me anyway?"

The flustered giantess looked away for a moment.

"You were the one making such offer," she said,
"And I'm sure you can understand if I... ask something in return, like you said."

You were reminded of your own words, and offered a nod.

"Yeah, you're right," you agreed,
"Go on."

Uxie inhaled deeply.

She couldn't believe what she was going to ask, but this human seemed willing to do as she pleased, eager even.

There was a small percentage he wasn't going to decline her request, but the majority of chances was that he tried to get away as soon as he saw the opportunity.

Still, Uxie gathered enough courage to 'look' back at you and make her request,
132331312.title: Uxie's condition

choices: "Of course, I'll help you," Meloetta chimed, concerned
"Of course, I'll ‘help’ you..." Meloetta said with a mischievous smirk...
1323321.content:
For a moment, all you could see was your own reflection lost in an endless blue sea. You wondered what pokemon this could be, when a pesky cloud suddenly eclipsed moonlight, obscuring your sight as well.

In a desperate attempt to see what pokemon you were about to deal with, you took a few steps back, realizing that you had been stupidly staring at just a single eye of the legendary. You could tell this one was indeed one of the mythical pokemon whose existence itself was a doubt.

But you had never seen a pokemon so human-looking aside from Jynx, but this couldn't be one of those. You observed the pokemon's head, which was perfectly round. You thought you were in presence of Celebi or perhaps Manaphy, before your mind told you that the heads of those legendaries weren't so perfectly round-shaped.

You struggled to figure out what pokemon this could be, but you found that there was no need to.

The annoying, cold wind that pierced your uncovered body blew away the as well annoying cloud, allowing moonlight to enlighten the night again while also letting you finally observe the details of the legendary's face.

The pokemon had a milk-white visage, those gigantic blue eyes you were staring at before were still focused completely on you; a thin, horizontal slit was the legendary's mouth, and a jewel the same color of its eyes rested right in between the giant oculars. In the end, the pokemon had a veritable waterfall of green hair, while its face was covered by its black body, which resembled a... dress?

You felt a knot in your stomach as well a lump in your throat that kept you from speaking.

This was Meloetta, a singing legendary whose melodies alone were legends themselves. Only few have been blessed enough to be able to hear Meloetta singing.

Your heart leaped in excitement, you were going to be one of those people! You could proudly say that you witnessed Meloetta singing from up close!

You remained still, waiting for the legendary to make the first move lest you doing anything that might have offended the adorable legendary might have ended with you erased from existence.

Slowly, the Meloetta blinked, bemused, before she began standing back up from her laying position, letting you witness the full sight of her.

Two slim, with legs came out from an extension of her ‘dress’ that looked like a skirt, a green ‘belt’ tied around the legend's waist.

"Hello, little human," a soothing, melodious voice rang around you.

Your eyes still glued to Meloetta, you saw her lips moving as the voice was heard, so it could be only her speaking.

You felt elated, not only you were staring at a legendary, and a giant one too, but she also had the ability to speak!

This kept getting better!

You couldn't even think of replying, completely under the spell of the gracious pokemon.

"Please do not be afraid by me, I have no intention of eating you or something along those lines. I was merely..." she interrupted herself, and you felt an invisible grip tugging on you.

Then, you began hovering in mid-air, most likely held by the Meloetta's Psychic.

You flew up to the legendary, who held out a paw, which was black and completely round, lacking any fingers.

The psychic grip dispersed, letting you fall down.

You landed straight on top of the Meloetta's paw, which she rose up a bit.

"... Wondering how a human can be so small. Your kind is usually bigger than this, am I right?" she continued, cracking a friendly smile.

Still stunned by what was going on, you couldn't respond, so you simply nodded your head several times.

"So, you must have shrunken down to that size. May I ask you why?" the Meloetta kept speaking in that wonderful, heavenly melodious voice of hers, each word like spoken from an angel,
"I mean, this forest forest is a dangerous place for little things such as yourself." she added.

Your vocal chords seemed to be able to work again all of a sudden.

"I... I didn't shrink myself..." you replied in a whisper,
"I don't know how it happened..." you continued in a soft voice, like you were living a dream you didn't want to wake up from.

However, just as suddenly as it began, the spell was broken.

Like popping a bubble, the cold roughly snapped you back to reality, the hard reality that you were shrunken and in the middle of the woods with a giant and potentially dangerous legendary.

You began shivering.

During your whole dream-like state, you forgot that you were naked, which wasn't bad only because you were in presence of such legendary, but because the cold-

"Human?" the Meloetta's voice spoke up again, carrying a hint of concern.

However, you didn't pay attention.

In an attempt to stop the cold from penetrating your skin, you folded your arms and began rubbing, trying to find the least amount of hear that would have saved you.

It didn't work, obviously.

You felt each molecule of your body becoming cold. You felt like your brain and heart, along with the rest of your internal organs, were shutting down by the sheer force of the cold, which gripped you like a hungry, feral animal, wanting to claim you as a victim.

You were about to enter pass out, you knew. If you did, you would've most likely entered hypothermia, only to slowly freeze to death if you didn't manage to get your body to warm up.

However, you had forgotten that Meloetta was there.

Suddenly, your perch on her fingerless hand shifted, and you found yourself moving forward. You were pressed right into her chest area, while her other, free paw joined the first one as the mythical pokemon embraced you.

A feeble warmth spread throughout your body like a shield, a fragile protection against the cold.

Shivering, you glanced at the Meloetta pleadingly.

"H-H-He-Help..." you stuttered through chattering teeth.
"I-I-" cold penetrated your mouth as well, shutting down your vocal chords, much like they had done while you were under the Meloetta's spell.

Said legendary let your request, so feebly spoken, sink in the depths of her mind before replying,
1323321.title: A gracious savior

choices: Meloetta let you eat: you had to regain your strength, and she wanted to talk
Meloetta opted to search for a better shelter first
Another pokemon showed up to the legendary...
13233211.content:
Upon hearing your words, so weakly spoken by a being so little rapidly shutting down because of the cold, Meloetta felt a bout of pity assaulting her.

She won't allow this tiny human to die in her arms, she decided.

"Of course," she spoke melodiously, her voice acting like a tranquilizer for you,
"I'll be happy to aid you, dear human. You don't need to fear."

While speaking, the green-headed tightened the grip she had on you; without warning, she began rubbing you in between her fingerless, black paws and her chest.

She began speeding up a bit, and a feeble heat started spreading through your body. It was better than freezing to death, but it was nowhere near enough. You expressed this by letting out a gasp, a cloud exiting your mouth and ending up dispersing in the air.

Meloetta took notice of it and tilted her head - it wasn't working.

She needed to come up with something better real quick.

"Hang on in there, dear," she said you, concerned; you didn't reply.

Meloetta began looking around, wondering what she could do to help since her actions weren't enough.

She kept calm, but that calm was rapidly waning: Meloetta never had to deal with dying shrunken humans before.

Out of options, the green-headed legendary scanned the forest, searching for anything that might be helpful.

And that's when she struck gold: lying on the forest floor, abandoned in a patch of grass, was the human's shirt, which didn't shrink along with him; a little farther was his pair of pants, which suffered a fate similar to the shirt's.

A smile lit the giantess' white visage as she hastily picked up the shirt with her psychic powers and hovered it towards her arms.

She looked at you, giving you a warm smile.

"Don't need to fear, human," she repeated once more,
"You will be fine."

Then, dark became your vision as your shirt was dropped over you. Meloetta hastily wrapped it around you until she formed a ball of fabric that shielded you from the cold.

Warmth began spreading through your body at a faster rate, albeit your teeth didn't stop chattering.

Nonetheless, with remaining consciousness you had, you felt grateful towards the kind giantess that was helping you.

As for the legendary herself, she moved quick: she gathered all your belongings with Psychic and, as they hovered in the air, she flew further into the woods with the improvised blanket and the precious life that currently resided in it in her arms.

Fast as she could be, Meloetta soared through the woods with a camping bag and a pair of pants in tow.

A few pokemon who were still awake fled at the sight of the legendary while she flew past.

Eventually, the legendary reached her destination: a particularly big tree which, she knew, could offer a refuge.

She stopped near the trunk and began fluttering upward, reaching one of the tallest branches. In the trunk, there was a big hole, not fit for big pokemon but surely enough to take a small pokemon such as Meloetta and her shrunken 'guest'.

Meloetta didn't waste anymore time and entered the precarious shelter and gathered a few leaves on the floor with Psychic, forming a small bed on the wood.

Not exactly the place she'd call home, but extreme situations require extreme measures. She would search for a better place for the human to recover in the morning, she decided, when the risk of losing his life because of the cold was minimal.

Quietly, letting out a small sigh, the green-headed pokemon unwrapped the shirt from around you a bit to check on you.

What she saw made her panic - your eyes were closed.

With her heart jumping in her throat, Meloetta hastily moved you closer to check if yours was still beating, but there was no need to: when she moved you closer, she noted that you were still breathing, slowly but rhythmically, meaning that you merely lost consciousness.

The legendary let out a deep sigh. For now, you were safe.

--

Hours faded away as the night drew on, eventually coming to an end as morning came.

The moon took its leave in the sky to make room for its brighter, warmer counterpart as the sun rose into the sky.

Sunlight began to shine throughout the forest, blinking into a certain hole and getting straight into your eyes.

You moaned in your sleep, before ultimately waking up.

You opened your eyes and took a look around, still shaken by a very vivid dream you've had.

Giant pokemon, a near death and... and...

You were not in your bedroom...

"Wha..." you mumbled, pushing whatever was covering you aside.

"Oh, are you awake? Good." a voice spoke from behind you, leading you to turn around.

There, sitting in the corner of a place you didn't recognize, was a certain green-headed you could recognize: she was the same one that appeared in your dreams, which apparently weren't dreams.

"Meloetta!" you chimed, before the weight of reality began falling on you and it dawned on you that you were really about to lose your life just last night.
"... I really was about to pass away back then, huh?" you told, your whole soul letting out a sigh of relief and gratitude towards the legendary who heroically rescued you from death itself.

Meloetta bit her lip and slowly nodded her round head while her blue eyes sparkled with a sad glint.

"You are safe now. That's all that matters." she replied.

"Yeah, thanks to you." you replied,
"If you weren't there, this conversation wouldn't be happening right now. So, from the bottom of my heart... thank you..." you murmured,
"I don't know how I'll ever repay you."

"Don't even mention that." she said, her cheeks displaying a faint red shade,
"How are you feeling?"

"Better than last night, that's for sure..."

The giantess giggled.

"Glad to hear that." she said, before adopting a more serious expression,
"Now, I'm sure you might want to eat, but we should look for someplace better for you too..." she told as she began pondering which was the most important priority.
13233211.title: Sweet savior

choices: Meloetta shoved you in her mouth and started to toy with you inside!
Meloetta placed you in her skirt, right by her crotch!
13233212.content:
The Meloetta watched you shivering in her grip.

There you were, a tiny, helpless human lost in the middle of the woods and in the paws of a legendary who could easily do what she wanted to you if she only wanted to.

Meloetta seemed to realize that as well, because a grin suddenly spread across her face, though keeping at a rather short length.

It wasn't any sadistic or lustful smile, but that smirk alone had the power of making you shiver even more. Plus, you were quite sure that this giantess had her eyes fixated on your-

Your embarrassing train of thought was interrupted as the Meloetta seemingly returned to reality.

"Why of course, my tiny friend, I shall aid you in this dire situation of yours," she spoke.

Her voice was so soothing, so sweet, that you felt tempted to just lay your head against her chest, sink in deep sleep and let her do whatever she wished with you.

Not like you had any other choice with your brain slowly freezing alongside the rest of your body.

But with an effort that took up most of your willpower, you managed to remain awake while the green-headed giantess shot you another smile, before slowly and gently tightening her grip around you.

With her fragile passenger precariously shielded from the cold, Meloetta began hovering deeper into the thick forest, completely abandoning your bag to its fate.

The freezing wind started blowing even faster, causing you to shiver against Meloetta's body, which was the only reason why you were still alive.

Her bodily heat transferred to you. Not like it was enough to miraculously put you out of danger, but it was still enough to allow you to prolong your life.

"Just hold on human, I'll take you somewhere warmer," Meloetta spoke reassuringly, causing you to once again fall under her spell, though only for a few seconds before the cold snapped you back to reality once again.

It all seemed a surreal nightmare.

It was like Meloetta wasn't even there, it was like you were alone, mysteriously hovering through the endless forest, showered by a cold wind while moonlight enlightened the whole, dark forest, causing the trees to adopt all sorts of weird, scary shapes as Meloetta passed them in search of a shelter from the cold.

As if all of this wasn't enough, the giantess kept staring at you with a weird look on her face every once in awhile; but you didn't feel uncomfortable, you didn't have any strength left to.

All your thoughts were about the sad reality that you were about to die, and all your strength was used for survival.

Eventually though, Meloetta finally got to the first shelter she could find.

"Do not worry any further, human, we've arrived at a safe place," she reassured, causing you to glance past her large arms.

It could be nothing more than a simple, thin crack in a stone wall, but it looked like large enough for Meloetta, and surely enough for you, to fit completely inside.

Carefully, Meloetta entered the small opening which, she discovered, led to a little cavern.

Without wasting time, the small legendary hovered to the deepest part of the small cavern, to the further spot from the freezing wind that threatened to kill you earlier.

Quickly, Meloetta turned her attention to you and began rubbing her rubbing her small paws, with you on between, together.

You let out a deep sigh as your nearly frozen body began regaining a little amount of warmth while Meloetta gently rubbed her large paws all over your naked being.

Eventually, the gracious legendary stopped rubbing your body, which was now warm enough to keep you from dying on Meloetta.

"Here. Feel any better?" she asked as she moved her paws forward, staring at you, trapped in between them.

"Y-Y-Yeah," you stammered out,
"T-Thanks f-for saving m-me..."

Meloetta smiled.

"Dear, you're still cold," she pointed out.

And you saw that familiar little grin of hers once again crawling across her face, while her huge blue eyes shone with a mischievous spark

"Maybe I have a better remedy for that..." she spoke.

With fear mixed with curiosity, you wondered what Meloetta was up to.
13233212.title: Mischievous Meloetta

132332121.content:
Meloetta's grin bore down on you as you gulped, waiting for her solution. She contemplated what to do with you before she came to a conclusion. It WOULD warm you up, and she wanted to have a bit of...fun with you too. She giggled as you felt yourself lifted up and up to her face her mouth started to open wide.

"U-um...what are you d-doing?" You stammered, but you got no reply. Instead a rush of warm breath blasted you, instantly making you feel better in temperature, but you were getting far more nervous about this pokemon by the second. You felt yourself moving forward, towards her mouth, like a small cavern to you.

"Please d-don't do this!" You pleaded, but you got no answer as she slowly moved you closer and closer. You tried to squirm and struggle in her paws, but it proved to get you nowhere as she easily overpowered you without a hint of effort. You heard a loud giggle, it rang in your ears from the close proximity of her mouth and soon enough all you could see was the insides of her mouth. She started to put you in headfirst, and you tried to flail your hands to grab her lips and stop your movement, but you didn't manage to even reach them before she plopped you down on her large tongue. You were instantly coated in warm saliva, and you saw the opening behind you close. You whimpered a bit. "PLEASE DON'T EAT ME!" You cried out.

Meloetta had no intention of doing that, she was having fun with you, toying with a tiny shrunken human, but she had no intent to kill you.

That was until she tasted you...you tasted really good! This was not what she had expected.

"Mmm~" She managed to let out as she started to suck on you.

You were meanwhile, scared out of your wits and having a hard time of it. Saliva dripped down on you from above, and the whole mouth started to flood with it after a few moments of you being in here. You definitely weren't freezing anymore, this whole experience was like a disgusting sauna, you were pretty warm in here. You tried to stand on the tongue but every slight movement of it knocked you off balance, and it wasn't long before motions moved you against a wall, pinning you there as she sucked on you, you were against her cheek.

"M-Meloetta, please!" You cried as she pinned you to the other cheek.

She heard your cries, but disregarded them. It wasn't like she was a mean or hostile pokemon by nature, she just saw a fun time at your expense, but now...she was considering maybe swallowing you. You tasted great, and to have you as a snack would!

...Probably kill you, she realized. She frowned at this. She didn't intend to do that, and in the end you were just a little human that somehow shrunk and probably needed help. He didn't deserve to be swallowed right?

She contemplated this, and you felt a sudden lurch as Meloetta made her move.
132332121.title: In Meloetta's mouth

1323321212.content: With a few gulps, Meloetta sent you to her belly. "Sorry, but you were too tasty. At least your gonna look great on my ass," she said. Her eyes glowed blue, and her gut expanded as her meal was grown bigger. Meloetta sighed and patted her squirming belly. Your body steadily started to melt. Meloetta burped and massaged her belly, speeding up the process. You Kick and thrash to no avail, as your limbs start to lose function, and your vision fades. A few minutes later, Meloetta flew off, patting her round ass. "Maybe I should start Gurgling more Humans," she thought.

She let go of her "skirt" and let it fall over you, sealing off much of the light from outside, but that part wasn't what caught you by surprise; the mere fact she put you up her skirt was shocking, and before long you felt her paw gently pushing you further back into her. The next thing you knew, you were standing right in front of something exuding heat and with a very faint musky scent wafting out. You didn't need to be told what your back was up against.
         "There~…" Meloetta cooed almost in a whisper. "Aren't much warmer now my little human? My warmth is far more pleasant than the outside is it not?" What say you my little human?" You didn't know what was more awkward for you to deal with: the fact that Meloetta—a pokemon—honest-to-god confessed to wanting to mate with a human (and that you happen to be her type), or the fact that her silk-laden voice with a hint of lust next to your increased exposure to her intimates was giving you a raging stiffie. Her sounding like a young woman and the knowledge of being so close to pussy almost made you jump at the offer, but the knowledge that she was a pokemon made you feel very conflicted about this. You truthfully weren't into pokemon as a whole, but there was something about Meloetta that made you consider the possibility of making an exception for her if you could. Before she could say or do much else, you went over your decision and came to a choice…

13233231.title: Zeraora

13233232.content: Which Shaymin form do you want?
13233232.title: Shaymin

132332322.content:
You turn around to see a giant emerald sheen eye looking strait at you, curiosity within it. You recognize the soft paw holding you is connected to a silky white body with some grass and flowers on the top of the body. The Pokemon that is holding you is a Shaymin.

The Shaymin's paw tilts you left to right, her head following yours, as the expression on it's face goes from curiosity to confusion.

"I-I've never seen a b-bug Pokemon like you b-before." The Shaymin stutters. You notice that the Shaymin has a pretty feminine voice, and she doesn't recognize you as a human as well.

"I'm actually a human. Nice to meet you." You say as nice as possible. A second passes between you two, as you and her stare at each other. You then hear a short scream, and the paw's grip letting go of you, allowing you to call to the ground.

You land with a thud, as you stare at the sky for a few seconds, keeping yourself awake from the shock of your fall. You steadily stand up, and notice that the Shaymin is gone.

It doesn't take you very long, however, to find her, since she was poorly hiding in the grass, shaking. You decide, even though your inner instincts are telling you not to go near a creature that is 4x the size of you, to approach the startled hedgehog.

As you get closer to her, she shuffles away from you, still shivering in fear. "P-p-please don't hurt me." She squeaked, covering her head with her hands. You put your hands onto the back of the Shaymin, which makes her jump a bit.

"It's okay, I'm not gonna hurt you." You comfort, hugging her, well, as best as a 2 inch man can hug an 8 inch grass hedgehog. It does work, though, since you feel Shaymin's heartbeat calming.

You let go of Shaymin, and kind of lean your back onto her body. You then feel a shift as the Shaymin starts to stand up and face you.

"I-It's nice to meet you too, I'm Shaymin" She smiles, raising her front paw as if for you to shake it. "I've never s-seen a human so s-small. Did something h-happen?"

"Yeah, I kind of shrank, and I have no way of turning to normal size." You say, scratching the back of your head. "Do you have any way to grow me back?"

The Shaymin thinks for a little. "No, I don't think I'm able to g-grow you back, but I d-do have an idea."

"What is it?" You ask hopefully.
