1323323431.content: Which one of the brother and sister?
1323323431.title: Latios/Latias

13233234312.content:
You feel yourself being lifted up by...... nothing? You do notice, however, that you are encased in a weird blue-like aura, so whatever is lifting you up is psychic. You feel your body involuntarily being spun around to face a pair of yellow eyes and a white and red color scheme all over the Pokemon's body, except for the blue triangle on its chest. You notice right away that the Pokemon that's lifting you up is a Latias.

Her face looked motionless, almost in a state of shock. "Uhh... Hello." You muster, which breaks her state of shock, which she now wears an emotion of excitement.

"Oh my Arceas! I've never seen a human before!" The Latias excitedly says, dropping you onto her hands. "I didn't know they were so small and cute but... AAAAA you're so cute!" She squees, bringing you to her feathery chest, squeezing you there.

As uncomfortable the squeezing is, it does feel very nice and almost relaxing, not to mention warm. "I've always wanted to see a human, but I always heard that they were dangerous and vile beings from other Pokemon." She lifts you from her chest and brings you back to her face. "But you don't look dangerous or vile at all." She says, giving you a little peck on the cheek, or side of your body if you will. "I just wonder how-"

"Latias, where are you?" You hear a male voice calling from far away. Shoot, it's my brother Latios. She looks at you with some concern, "I don't know how he'd react to you."

You see Latias think hard about the decision she has to make, and she decides to...
13233234312.title: Latias

132332343122.content:
"HEY, LATIOS, OVER HERE! I WANT TO SHOW YOU SOMETHING!" You hear Latias yell, waving her hand in the air. You see from the bushes near you another Latias, but blue instead of white. This must be Latios then.

"What's the 'thing' you want to show me?" You hear the Latios say with the same male voice that called for Latias before. "This!" She lifts you up with both hands to show Latios, which his face immediately shows surprise. "Umm, Latias?"

"Isn't it cool, he's a human. Look at how small and adorable he is!" She says, physically bobbing in air in excitement. "Uhh, hello." You say, really unable to find proper words to say at the moment.

"Hello?" Latios replies, clearly confused. "Latias, I don't think humans are that small, and besides, were not supposed to let humans find out we're here. We're going to have to leave him here."

"No, he'd be lonely out here, or even worst," Latias holds you close to her chest, "He'd die! Please let him stay with us."

Sigh "There is getting through to you, is there? Fine, we can ask the human what he wants." You see Latios's eyes shift over to you. "Human, would you rather stay with me and my sister, or be left here to fend for yourself. I should probably tell you, if you do go with us, you will not go back to mankind. Choose wisely"
132332343122.title: Small Surprise

choices: Latias wanted to go to sleep and brought you along
Latios wanted to talk to you
1323323431221.content:
"W-Wha-?" you stammered, feeling your heart sinking at the words of the blue and white monolith that was staring at you; Latias too had her large, golden eyes fixed on you.
"But... why?"

Latios offered a sigh that nearly blew you away in his sister's paws.

"I'm afraid we cannot afford bringing you back to your kind. We can't afford getting near your kind for what matters," he explained,
"We can't afford getting captured."

You lowered your head, daunted.

You couldn't go back to normal and you couldn't go back to humanity; but you couldn't stay here, alone, either. As miserable as your situation was, you valued life very much and didn't want to lose that.

"But look on the bright side, cutie!" Latias cooed behind you,
"You can stay with us, and we will take good care of you! Right, Latios?"

"You can do that..." her brother muttered.

He didn't feel any negative feelings coming from this small human aside from a strong, understandable sense of despair. Still, the blue pokemon couldn't bring himself to fully trust this small one. Not yet anyway.

Latias shot a brief glare in direction of her brother, before staring down at you again with a much kinder expression.

"Come on with us. I promise you won't regret it." she reassured.

You sighed.

Your life slid before your very eyes as you couldn't believe you were about to throw all that away.

"I..." you trailed off, inhaling deeply and exhaling heavily,
"... What other choice do I have?"

None of the two legendaries replied as you sulked onto the red one's paws.

You looked away.

"I'm in."

The moment those words left your mouth, Latias looked immensely happy and Latios nodded his head in agreement.

Suddenly, you found yourself being rubbed against a very soft, warm surface: Latias was once more showing affection.

"Sis, let's get out of here." Latios spoke,
"We've got to find a place to spend the night, and we need to accommodate the human. It's cold tonight."

Your earlier concerns about hypothermia came back and you found yourself agreeing.

"Okay! Let's go find someplace where we can spend the night!" Latias happily chimed, before looking at you; once more, you found yourself enveloped in a blue glow and floated over to the the red giantess' head, landing on top.

"Hang on tight, 'kay?" Latias warned.

"Not too fast, Latias," her brother said, before fluttering past his sister and further into the woods; Latias was about to emulate him, but you stopped her,

"Wait!" you yelled, tapping her skull,
"My bag! There's stuff in it!"

Latias turned to see your discarded bag resting with your abandoned clothes, which were now impossibly big for you to wear.

"Oh... well, we're bringing it along, then." she declared, picking the bag up with her Psychic.

Then, before giving you any other chance to speak, she took off, chasing after her brother.

You were going so fast you had to lay belly-down on her head and try to hang on while she flew through the woods.

Eventually, she caught up with Latios and the two of them flew together through the woods.

If you felt cold before, what you were experiencing now was much worse: with the cold wind blowing right in your face, you felt like your skin was assaulted by billions of tiny thorns that slowly crawled within your body.

Still, you kept hanging on even when you felt like you were deprived of energy.

Luckily, the trip didn't last for much longer.

"Here." Latios instructed, stopping before a cavern, getting his sister to stop as well; barely even conscious, you looked over Latias' head and saw Latios focusing as he tried to sense anyone within or near the cave.

When he didn't, he floated inside, followed by his sister.

"Great, we're not sleeping in the woods tonight," Latias happily stated, before looking up,
"What about you, human? What do you think?"

No reply.

Latias set your bag down.

"Human?"

She picked your body from her head with Psychic and gasped when she saw the state you were in.

"Quick, warm him up!" Latios exclaimed in alert.

Latias nodded and immediately cupped you in her paws, which she brought closer to her before starting to blow warm air from her mouth and into her paws.

It took a while, but eventually the heat chased the cold away and you finally felt better.

Latias took notice of that and stopped, offering a small smile of relief.

"T-Thanks." you said, still a bit shaken.

"Don't even mention that," she said cheerfully, beginning to nuzzle you.

You blushed and looked over to the side, noting Latios staring in silence.

Once the red giantess was done showing affection, she pulled back, allowing you to see your new, warmer (though still quite cold) environment.

"So... we're staying in here tonight?" you wondered.

"Yes." Latios answered with a nod.

You gave a nod of your own and fell into silence, still wondering how this all happened.

But, at least, you were with friendly guardians.

It couldn't be so bad, after all, could it?
1323323431221.title: Eon life

choices: ... Embraced you to warm you up
... Tossed you in her mouth, curious about your taste
... Moved you to her nethers, feeling lustful
13233234321.content:
The Pokemon towering over you was one you saw before, somewhere in a book, and it made you feel very intimidated with its presence alone, since you knew what power it possessed.

No wonder for a legendary Pokemon.

It had a small, dark grey body with short limbs, its head shaped like some sort of flame. Its eyes were fiery red and looking straight at you. It was a Marshadow, a Pokemon that could come and go from the shadows at will, and it was highly recommended not to make it angry in the slightest, because despite the body, it was said to have a huge power.

After staring at it for a few moments, you backed up, startled from the sudden appearance. Was it hiding in your shadow? Following you?... Was it the cause of your shrinking?

You backed up, the giant standing perfectly still, just staring at you. Then, you tripped over a root and fell with your butt on the hard ground.

You quickly recovered from the impact and looked back at the giant... from this new angulation, you could see something, right in between the legendary's stubby legs and blushed: this giant was actually a giantess...

You remained still, simply staring at the legendary, who stared back at you without moving nor speaking.

But then, she took a step towards you, causing your heart to start lifting to your throat.

Another step. And another, until she was looming over you once more.

Then, with slow motions, she began bending, her hand extending as she went to grab a hold of you.

You fought the urge to crawl away lest it'd anger the giantess and let her scoop you up.

You were brought up to the Marshadow's fiery eyes as she fixed a neutral stare on you. She didn't look hostile nor friendly. She was just... studying you, maybe trying to determine what you were on, in the worst of cases, if you were edible or not.

The ghost-type examined you in silence for a few minutes, moving her paw back and forth.

You didn't say a word either, but you felt very scared.

Until you began to feel very weak.

At first, the circumstances led you to think the Marshadow was doing something to you but then logic led you to a different conclusion: you were naked in a frosty night with a much weaker body than it used to be.

You were starting to freeze.

In an attempt to warm yourself up, you grabbed both your shoulders as you embraced yourself and began rubbing your naked body, but it was pointless, as what little amount of heat you managed to get in your body quickly dispersed.

Desperate, you looked back at Marshadow with a pleading stare,

"Help..." you whispered, fearing for your life, which was probably gonna end if you didn't get away from here soon.

Luckily, the giantess seemed to understand and, silent as she had been so far, she began walking, her feet not making a noise.

She began picking up the pace and her walk became faster while you sat on her paw, trying your best to get some warmth to enter your body, going so far as laying down and rubbing yourself on Marshadow's hand. The giantess either didn't mind or ignored you, because she kept going through the forest.

Normally, a Marshadow would use the shadows to move since they had an ability similar to Gengar's to become one with the shadow. However, humans like yourself did not posses such ability, meaning that if she was to jump in a shadow, you'd be left behind to die alone.

You just laid on her hand, trying to keep yourself conscious as the cold grew pungent and clouds of vapor began escaping from your mouth each time you inhaled.

Just your luck, you thought, shrinking on a cold night like this one.

Fortunately, this would go on for about a couple more minutes before Marshadow reached a small hole in a stone wall.

Apparently, she knew about it, because she slid inside without even thinking twice. Luckily, her body was small enough for her to fit and yours was way more than enough to fit inside the hole.

Darkness became your environment and, for a while, all you could see was the pair of fiery eyes belonging to Marshadow.

But then, a green light lit the place up.

You discovered that Marshadow's head had gone from dark grey to dark green, while her head was acting like a flame, as well as her neck and the back of her hands.

Your perch suddenly became warmer and, when your body became warmer as well, you breathed in relief.

Apparently, you were safe.

However, you quickly returned to reality: you were shrunken and in the hands of a Pokemon whose intentions were unclear. But, she saved you, so Marshadow was friendly, right?

You looked up at her, trying to find any traces of malice in her eyes, but she quickly looked away as she began a walk through the cave and went to sit down by a wall.

It was a good place to hide, you mused, since the hole was too small for any Pokemon, except maybe for a Joltik, to enter, though you doubted they'd be much of a match to your new host.

Again you, you looked at her, discovering that, once more, she was staring at you in silence.

This was starting to become awkward.

"... Thank you," you finally broke the ice, figuring you should have said something to her,
"Thank you for saving me. I doubt I would have made it out of that forest alive on my own."

Marshadow blinked, as if surprised from the fact that you could talk, and for several moments she didn't act.

But then, without any warning, the legendary...
13233234321.title: Silent as a shadow

choices: She kept silent and picked you up as she headed to gather food
132332343211.content:
With her body still emanating heat thanks to the green flames that came from it, Marshadow began lowering the hand you were on.

Initially, you thought she was going to put you on the ground, but then you realized where the paw, and consequently you, was headed.

Before you knew, you were pinned against the Marshadow's chest by the one paw that previously held you, and that was now holding you in place so that you didn't fall off.

The texture of her body was odd, like solid smoke, and it was fairly cold. You supposed a Pokemon that inhabited the shadows didn't get much warm, though the flames behind you were making up for her cold body.

Soon, her other paw joined the first as you were fully trapped in between them and the giantess' chest, your body rapidly retrieving the warmth it had previously lost.

You glanced at Marshadow the best you could, since the two large paws obscured your view.

Unable to get a glimpse of the giantess, you began squirming to get free from her grip, or to free at least your head.

While it was clearly saving your skin, you still couldn't be sure about her intentions, and feared that a quick moment of distraction could be lethal. Who guaranteed she was just warming you up because she didn't like her dinner cold?

Feeling you struggling in her grip, the legendary loosened a bit and looked down at you, shooting an inquisitive stare.

Those red eyes of hers stared deep into your soul, silently seeking for an answer to your unjustified struggles.

Seeing that you had her attention, you placed your hands on her chest and pulled yourself up a bit.

"Okay, I suppose I have to thank you," you spoke, deciding to assume that she could understand you. Legendary Pokemon were smart, after all, so smart that you had heard of some of them being able to speak human language without issue.
"But why are you doing this? Why are you helping me?" you warily asked, wondering what you could do in case the response (if it was ever going to come) was a negative one that you wouldn't appreciate.

The legendary giantess just stared at you for a few moments, as silent as ever.

That gaze of hers seemed hypnotic, her red eyes acting like two mirrors for you to see yourself, a doll stuck in the hands of such a small creature. However, they also carried a particular gleam, which in time carried a soothing sensation.

And then, Marshadow let a very small smile spread on her face.

That was the sole answer you got to your question, because she then trapped you in her paws once more, her face disappeared behind them.

This time, you didn't struggle.

You didn't know why, but you were gaining some trust for the giantess. It was safe to assume that she was just a kind soul who wanted to help you in dire times, in this case by keeping you from dying alone in the woods, either eaten by some of the larger beasts that wandered out there, crushed by the same beasts or even worse from the hypothermia you nearly died of before she brought you in this cave.

You laid still for what seemed an eternity, trying to recollect your thoughts, the only audible sound being the heartbeat of the legendary.

That did a good job soothing you. It was a rhythmic, hypnotic sound that didn't allow you to focus on the same line of thinking for more than just a few moments.

Then, as time drew on, you began feeling drowsy.

The soothing heartbeat and the comforting warmth were making really hard for you to focus, but you still didn't want to let your guard down.

You felt conflicted.

Could you trust in Marshadow's good faith and go to sleep?

You were so tired you quickly decided you didn't care. She was acting, if not friendly, at least not hostile either, and that was all you needed.

You closed your eyes, letting the warmth envelop all of your naked body and the rhythmic beats of her heart invade your mind, rid it off all thoughts until nothing remained.

Slowly, your body relaxed and your consciousness began to fade away as you nodded off to sleep in the paws of the legendary.

--

When you woke up, you felt like a great amount of time had passed.

Dazed, sleepy and probably still dreaming, you opened your eyes, blurry figures dancing around your eyes until they took on a shape.

You recognized the surroundings of the cave you had been brought in, a small twinkle of light peering inside from the tiny hole that served as an entrance, meaning two things: it must have been morning now, and yours was no dream.

This last realization soon led you to yet another one.

You looked around, remembering who helped you last night. However, Marshadow was nowhere in sight.

Had she abandoned you in the middle of nowhere!?

Already panicking, you failed to notice that things looked a bit darker from your point of view.

However, before you could collect your thoughts, you casually looked down... and nearly fell on your behind.

From the stone floor, a familiar pair of red eyes stared at you, seemingly from inside the floor itself.

However, as your mind began to put two and two together, you realized that your new legendary friend, if so you could dare to call her, had taken shelter within your shadow.

"Um... hi?"

There was no reply, but the shadow suddenly trembled as from it the familiar titaness emerged, until she was towering above you much like she had been when she first found you in the forest floor.

"Um... good morning..." you awkwardly said, wondering how you could speak to someone who didn't make a noise,
"I... thanks for saving me last night... guess I really owe you..." you said.

Marshadow offered one of those small smiles of hers, before returning stoic as ever, once more staring you down without saying a word nor making a move.

You felt uncomfortable under her gaze, mostly because of the sheer size of her eyes alone, even though they still carried that caring gleam in them.

For several moments, nothing interesting happened as you and the legendary just stared at each other.

At some point it even seemed she wanted to say something, as you saw her lips trembling, but you could easily be mistaken.
132332343211.title: A night in darkness

choices: A few days went by. You and Marshadow had bonded...
Some time with Marshadow passed, and she had grown very attached...
1323323432111.content:
You were proved right when you saw that Marshadow's lips were actually shaking, as if she wanted to say something.

However, she appeared to rethink and shut her mouth once more, just staring at you in complete silence.

You stared right back at her, feeling a bit uneasy with this silence. So, you decided to break it,

"Do... do you want to tell me something?" you asked, trying to get this giantess to open to you.

She didn't make a sound, but her head moved up and down in a slow fashion as she nodded.

"Well... what is it?" you asked, wondering if she could even speak human language like some of her fellow legendaries did.

Marshadow blinked twice, and stood unmoving for a minute.

Then, moving slowly, she took a knee and extended her hand towards you, stopping with her palm up a few inches from you.

You looked at her, she looked at you in silence - an invitation to climb on.

You hesitated for a moment, then hopped in the middle of the legendary's palm.

"There." you said.

Moving her hand slowly, carefully, the giantess brought it up in front of her face, right by her mouth. The closeness with such thing made you a lot more nervous, considering what it was.

You saw the two lips parting and, for a moment, fear invaded your mind.

However, it quickly dispersed when you heard Marshadow whispering,

"Are you alright?"

"H-Huh?" you stammered, her voice so low that, even from this close, you couldn't fully hear it.

Regardless, you exclaimed,

"So you CAN talk!"

Marshadow nodded a few times, her face adopting a small smile, before she repeated with a concerned tone,

"Are you alright?" she asked,
"You nearly froze last night."

Geez, her voice was so low that you doubted someone normal-sized would be able to hear it, which was probably why Marshadow liked to keep quiet.

"I noticed." you replied, before smiling her way,
"But I'm fine now, and it's thanks to you. I would've died for sure if it wasn't for your help."

Marshadow didn't reply to that, but smiled again, evidently pleased by your gratitude. You guessed she didn't get much, being a Pokemon who usually wandered the shadows.

"By the way, you're really small for a human." she said.

"I noticed." you repeated sarcastically.

"Why?" Marshadow asked.

"If you are asking why I'm so small... I'm afraid I have no idea," you answered, shrugging,
"I was taking a hike, and the next thing I know is that I passed out. When I woke up, I was like this." you explained.

The giantess remained silent.

You felt the need to ask,

"Do... do you have any clue why I shrunk down to this size? That would be really helpful."

Marshadow kept silent for a while longer, leading you to think if you had made a wrong question, or worse, if she was the one behind your shrinking.

Legendaries did carry a lot of odd powers after all, time travel, aura manipulation and so on, who said shrinking other living beings wasn't among those abilities.

However, Marshadow's eventual reply proved your theory wrong,

"I don't know how you shrunk down to that size." she said in the usual whisper, before adding,
"Sorry."

You could swear her voice adopted a barely noticeable flustered tone as she spoke the last word.

You sighed.

"So I gotta assume you don't know how to help me grow big again." you muttered, before looking at her pleadingly,
"Please, don't tell me you don't know how to help me grow big again."

Marshadow's answer wasn't a 'no'. However, it wasn't a 'yes' either.

In fact, she didn't reply at all.

Not wanting to delude your expectations, the giantess simply kept silent and kept staring at you. After several minutes of silence, you just lowered your head and sighed resignedly.

"I guess that's a no, then," you said.

"Sorry." came the whispered answer you were waiting for, which confirmed that you were stuck with this size for who knew how long, potentially forever.

The thought was really depressing.

You were small and defenseless, unable to protect yourself even from the cold brought by the night.

You didn't see any bright side in this. You had to face the truth, you were doomed.

However, Marshadow was still there.

"Human," she said, bringing her free hand to your head, her small finger placing itself under your head as she lifted it up, forcing you to look at her; she was smiling,
"I know it seems bad. I'm sure it is."

"You have no idea."

"But I can help, somehow." she said,
"I can watch over you, if you wish. I'll feed you. Water you. Whatever you need."

You were surprised by her offer.

"R-Really...?" you asked.

She offered a nod, though one a bit more enthusiastic, you could tell by its speed.

Clearly, she was happy to have someone to keep her company, while you were more than happy to have someone to protect and feed you.

Your choice was obvious, but you simply had to say,

"I take it you can't take me back to town so I can get some actual help with my size."

Marshadow remained silent.

By now, you knew what that meant, so you said,

"I'm in."

The smile came back to Marshadow's face.

"Great." she said in that ghostly whisper that was her voice,
"Don't worry, human. I promise, I'll take care of you."

Not knowing how to reply, you simply shot a smile as small as hers.

Perhaps, there was a bright side after all, even if it lied in a shadow.
1323323432111.title: The bright side in a shadow

choices: 'There's a lake around here. Let's go wash up.'
'I feel a presence. There's some Pokemon around here...'
13233234321111.content:
"That's great to hear." you replied, before sighing.

You couldn't believe you actually agreed to this. You actually couldn't believe any of this, and began thinking this was only a nightmare.

However, logic quickly overpowered the illusion you were already creating around you: how many nightmares can save you from a certain death?

This was plain reality, you sourly mused, and the sooner you accepted it, the sooner you were going to adapt.

Marshadow's voice gently called you back to reality.

"Are you alright?" she asked for what had to be the tenth time since you woke up; you stared at her blankly,
"... You looked like you were pretty deep in thought." she justified.

"I-I... sorry," you apologized, exasperated,
"It's only... well, everything. This is going to take forever to get used to."

"That is understandable. It does seem like a big change." Marshadow replied.

You looked at her.

"... Is that supposed to be a joke?"

No reply. You briefly wondered if Marshadow even knew what a joke was, given her attitude. It wasn't like you were in the mood for size-related jokes, anyway.

You looked down.

"So-Sorry. I didn't meant to-"

"Don't worry, human." Marshadow whispered, deadpan, before an idea clicked in her mind,
"Would you like some fresh air? Something to eat, perhaps?"

She was trying to be nice, but her expression betrayed her intentions.

Still, some fresh air sounded good right now.

"That would be nice." you agreed.

The giantess didn't reply, but began moving towards the small opening in the stone that led outside; effortlessly, the ghost-type squeezed through.

Warm sunlight immediately greeted you. A nice change from the freezing night you barely escaped. It was nice to think that nature wasn't trying to kill you anymore, at least for now.

"So I guess- huh?" you were interrupted as you felt the ground suddenly getting much closer to you, though you soon realized that it was you who was getting closer to the ground; looking back, you saw your recently acquired caretaker lowering her hand.

Only after she let you down you asked why.

"I can't stand the sun." Marshadow quietly replied, right before taking a step forward, sinking into your shadow, which became much larger. You also noted that the world around you now appeared sort of blurry.

"W-What... what am I supposed to do then?" you asked, not really sure if the legendary could hear you; it soon turned out she could, because you heard her voice in your head, saying,

'Just walk. I'll guide you to some place where we can eat.'

Whoa.

For several seconds, you just stared in disbelief at your own shadow, which carried your host's glowing eyes.

The legendary could speak to you in your mind, was this possession!? Your heart skipped a beat at the thought, and it skipped more than one beat when you heard Marshadow speaking again,

'Not quite. I've merged with your shadow, becoming one with you.' she explained, before adding dejectedly,
'It's not possession.'

"... Sorry... wait, does that mean I'm actually hearing your thoughts!?"

'Yes.'

You were at a loss for words, so you decided to change the subject.

"So, where should I, uh..."

Hearing your thoughts, Marshadow began giving you indications.

'And don't worry about other Pokemon. I will deal with them if they threaten you.' she pointed out.

You shivered: you could live with being tiny, but you were never going to get used to this.

'... I'm not creepy.'

You sighed.

"Sorry."

--

Following the instructions your own shadow was giving you, you strolled through the quiet forest until you reached a particularly large tree; several berries hung from the branches, though you had no way of ever reaching them at your current stature.

Luckily, you had Marshadow.

The giantess silently slid out of your shadow and stood tall next to you, protected by the tree's shade; much like last night, you saw her head suddenly igniting with a green flame and, before you could ask questions, she delivered a single punch to the trunk, causing a few berries to fall from the lower branches to the ground.

When you pointed your eyes back to Marshadow, she had already returned to normal and was smiling slightly at you.

"Shall we eat?"

A moment later, you were sitting at the foot of the tree, filling your empty stomach.

"Honestly..." you said, pausing to take another bite out of your berry, which was as large as your lower body. You let the juicy, sweet flavor overwhelm your mouth for a moment before swallowing and resuming,
"... Food that's bigger than I am. I can't decided if that's awesome or humiliating."

Marshadow, who was sitting beside you, stopped in mid-bite to look at you.

"I think you should just stop thinking about your stature." she said, taking a bite, chewing and swallowing, ironically louder than she spoke,
"You're gonna adapt faster that way."

"That's a little hard, considering everything is huge compared to me, Marshadow." you retorted.

Marshadow thought for a moment.

"Perhaps." she admitted, swallowing the rest of her meal,
"But I'm sure there's got to be some bright side to it."

Coming from a Pokemon that was the exact opposite of 'bright', that was hilarious. Still, you were careful not to voice that thought, and were suddenly glad the giantess wasn't hearing your thoughts at the moment.

"I guess..." you muttered in response, quickly finishing your meal as well, taking a moment to stretch,
"So, what now?"

Marshadow didn't reply, busily munching on some other berries. It made sense that she wasn't satisfied yet; after all, a berry was like a watermelon to you. To her, it was more or less a potato chip.

Only after eating several more berries, Marshadow stood up, before looking at you; your eyes and hers met for a moment, right before she started sinking back into your shadow, looking as stoic as ever as her face slowly disappeared from sight, once more leaving nothing but a pair of fiery eyes to prove her existence.

Due your mind having technically become one with hers, you could hear her thinking a response to the question you previously made,
13233234321111.title: Living with a shadow

choices: Saviour in the form of a legendary.
13233234321113.content:
You and Marshadow had been living together for a good amount of time now. Maybe a month had passed since you first shrunk? In any case, Marshadow was still taking care of you. The only problem was... Marshadow herself. At first, she was fun to talk with. Meek, quiet and shy. Then, she became controlling. Despite you not seeing her you knew she was always watching from the shadows. You supposed it was probably her lonely nature trying to not lose her one friend but it was still really excessive.

The straw that broke the camels back on your opinion of her treatment of her was when you asked if you could see other pokemon. Almost instantaneously the cold had crept upon your back and the cave turned pitch black with shadow. The mild temperature in the air dropped to temperatures similar to when you had first shrunk, leaving you shivering on the floor to try and retain body heat. The thing that had broken you out of your panic was the same voice you had grown accustomed to over the days, let laced with a hint of lethality.

"No... You can't leave me..."

You mustered up your energy to reply to her, trying to pacify her to not only stay alive but also to quell her fears. "I-I'm not going to l-leave you. D-don't worry."

After you said this the temperature had gone slightly up and allowed some light to come in, although you weren't out of the water yet. The shadows still far outnumbered the light and the cold was still dangerous.

"R-Really?" You heard Marshadow whisper out in her signature whisper, the edge in her voice much less than before.

"Y-yes! Really! I promise! I'll stay with you forever!"


After speaking those words the shadows all dissipated and all that was left was a black cloudy blob coming full force at you. Despite the temperature going up, you were still suffering from the after-effects of the extreme cold meaning you couldn't move at all. You were scooped up with the misty paws of the Female Marshadow and brought up to her lips. You were assaulted with kisses that, while not that bad were still starting to wear on you. Finally mustering up enough strength you stretch out your arms to at least signify to Marshadow that she needed to stop.

At long last, the assault had ended. Of course, that incident's after-effects still hadn't gone away, not one bit. If anything, they had grown stronger. You were confined to the small cave, being prohibited from leaving. One time you wanted to go to the entrance to look outside and Marshadow immediately pulled you back and held you within her grasp, despite not being there moments prior. You were locked in a cage made of shadows constructed using Marshadow's powers.


Of course, despite all the downsides you were still perfectly fed and clothed, along with water and shelter. Marshadow's constant acts of affection were getting bothersome, but they still felt filled with love and made you hope to a future where Marshadow's doubts about you staying are quelled, where the two of you can walk outside without Marshadow fearing the possibility of you running away.

A noise at the front of the cave snapped you out of your inner monologue. What was it?

A: A wild pokemon that just happened to come across this cave in the rare instances Marshadow was out hunting.
B: Marshadow along with another pokemon that she had befriended along the way. (You choose what pokemon)
C: A legendary pokemon had come to rescue you from the clearly over-obsessed pokemon. Marshadow may or may not decide to hunt them down to "save" you from their clutches. (You choose. The new legendary may also fall in love/obsessed with you, who knows!)
13233234321113.title: Obsessed.

13233234322.content: Perhaps one of the four Tapu, the guardians of Alola?
13233234322.title: Alola Guardians

132332343221.content:
Initially, thanks to the sheer darkness that engulfed you completely, you couldn't see two feet from your own nose.

As a result, you weren't able to distinguish the Pokemon that standing - hovering - before you.

Whether it had or not spotted you, you didn't know, because it was not moving, and you decided not to give away your position to a mysterious giant by moving recklessly, maybe yelling in fear like a spooked kid.

Instead, you chose to act carefully and not let the overwhelming fear best your mind.

You took a few steps back, deciding to try to determine what kind of Pokemon you were dealing with, maybe estimate the potential danger.

As more of the Pokemon came into your sight, you noted two things: one, the titan had some sort of shell around its body; two, the shell was slowly opening, and the Pokemon's eyes fixed... straight on you.

You gulped, having finally recognized what kind of Pokemon you were looking at, and it was no less than a legendary, one of the strongest beings in this world.

If you remembered correctly, it was one of the guardians of Alola, which was curious. What was it doing here, so far from home?

You couldn't ponder much more, because your thoughts were cut short as you were grabbed by...
132332343221.title: Standing before a guardian

choices: ... Kindness and concern. She cared about you
... Mischief and playfulness. You just agreed to be her playmate...
... Lust. Looks like she had found more than a companion...
1323323432212.content:
... Tapu Lele? Was that the name of the Pokemon that just grabbed you? It was, if you remembered correctly.

The titan had a slim, black figure with blue eyes. There was no mouth in sight on its face and there were long, pink hair falling from its head; the top of the head was covered by a pink, pointy shell, as was the lower body of the monolith whose grasp you were in.

Yep, definitely Tapu Lele.

You stared back at it as the giant studied your tiny body in its grasp, not making a sound while doing so.

As for you, you were initially too afraid to speak.

But, as time passed without the giant creature doing anything, you realized it had no interest in hurting you.

"Hey," you called out, hoping it'd understand you. It was a legendary, after all, and legendaries were supposed to be smarter than normal Pokemon, right,
"I, uh... need help! I'm lost!"

The titan blinked twice, seemingly perplexed.

Then, you heard a voice speaking directly in your mind,

"You are a human, right?" the voice spoke with a feminine tone, startling you. You looked around, trying to figure who it was speaking, before the same voice asked,
"How did a human like yourself get so small? What happened?"

You looked back at Tapu Lele, noting that she was staring at you.

"W-Was that you?"

The giant, or giantess apparently, nodded.

"Indeed." it answered. Both its looks and voice made you convince that Tapu Lele was actually female, which was odd. Legendaries were supposed to be genderless, after all, though this wasn't what concerned you right now.

You were in the hands of a potentially dangerous legendary, and such line of thinking worried you. Who knew how you were going to end if you made the mistake of ticking her off.

However, Tapu Lele seemed more intrigued in you than anything else.

"Tell me, human," she spoke, and for the first time you saw a tiny mouth opening on her face,
"How did you shrink to that size? Oh, tell me, tell me!" she said, sounding suddenly very excited.

Her excitement caught you off guard, and for several moments you didn't reply.

Then, you cleared your throat nervously.

"I... don't know, really..." you replied truthfully,
"I passed out and, when I woke up, I was like this! I'm shrunk and I'm lost, I need your help!"

"My help?" the legendary parroted back, seemingly surprised,
"Help with what?"

You were about to reply, when you suddenly noted how cold it was around you. A quick look down reminded you that you were naked, and that your more fragile organism wasn't going to survive the night if you were left by yourself.

"We-Well, could you start by bringing me away from here? It's cold!" you said, shivering, your skin starting to adopt a very pale tone.

Tapu Lele seemed to ponder your request.

"Meh. Not that cold." she said, and for the first time you noted how childish her voice sounded. Even more, it sounded like the one of a spoiled little girl.

Some guardian this giantess was.

"Please! I'll die if I'm l-left out here for too long!" you pleaded, your teeth beginning to chatter and your skin starting to adopt a faint shade of cerulean.

Tapu Lele waved her free arm.

"Don't be silly!" she said, before taking a good look at you,
"Hmm... you do seem to be in trouble though... aw, fine."

You suddenly felt yourself falling as Tapu Lele dropped you. You fell for a moment, before landing right inside of the giantess' pink shell. Immediately, heat washed over you as you sat up, noting that you were on a soft, black surface. Was this part of Tapu Lele's body?

You felt movement around you, and looked up to see that the giantess was retreating completely inside of the shell, forming a barrier against the cold.

"There. Happy now?" she said, sounding annoyed.

"Very. Thank you." you replied, feeling much better.

Instantly, the expression of the giantess changed, and a rosy tint appeared on her face.

"Oh, you're welcome!" she spoke cheerfully,
"I'll get you somewhere warmer! Don't worry."

You felt the shell around you starting to move as Tapu Lele began hovering, apparently knowing where she was going despite the fact she wasn't actually seeing the outside world.

... What a quick change of mood, you thought. From annoyed, she was now eager to help you out.

Weird.

--

Some time later, Tapu Lele arrived within a cavern, where she opened up her shell, letting her head pop out like a cork from a bottle, before she picked you out as well.

"There we go!" you heard her say in a chiming voice,
"Now, let's talk about business. I know, I'm a powerful psychic and a oh- ever so gracious legendary, but... I have no clue how to fix you. Your size, I mean."

You groaned. You didn't even get to ask, and you were already being denied. Great.

"So what am I supposed to do like this?" you wondered, starting to fear. Were you going to have to spend your whole life like this!?

"Well... technically, I shouldn't do this, buuuut... maybe you can stay with me." Tapu Lele offered, her voice betraying a certain excitement.

You pondered the offer, before thinking,
'What do I have to lose at this point?'

Still...

"Are you sure there is no way you could restore my size? Or do you happen to know anyone that could, y'know, like, other legendaries?"

The giantess shook her head.

You sighed.

"Guess I'm on board..." you replied.

Almost immediately, the giantess smiled.

"Great!" she said cheerfully, though you noted a certain glint in her eyes when she did.

It was a look of...
1323323432212.title: Childish Guardian

choices: You have to play a game with me. (Playful)
You have to do something for me. (Mischievous/Lustrious)
1323323432231.content:
The now humongous Poipole that's floating in the air grabs your small body, and brings it up to its face, looking at you very curiously. Its bright cyan eyes almost blinds you, as you try to draw your attention to somewhere less straining on your eyes. That's when you notice something about the Poipole, that it is a female, due to it having a slit between its legs.

"Hmm, interesting." You hear the Poipole say in a child-like voice say, as she lets go of everything except your leg, making you dangle. Looking at how far the ground and you are, a drop like that could serious injure, if not, kill you. You are spun to be eye to eye with the Ultra Beast, still looking at you with curious intentions. "I've never seen a human this small before... Hey, small human, can you understand me?"

"Y-yes, I-I can." You shudder without knowing. The frosty air around you is starting to affect you dramatically, especially with you just dangling from the Pokemon's hand.

"Huh, sounds like you're cold... Here. She grabs your dangling body and presses it on her chest, warming you up a little. "I haven't seen a human in such a long time. Are you guys usually this small?"

"No, not really. I kinda woke up this small just a few minutes ago." You reply, as the Poipole starts to float off somewhere. "Thank you for helping me, by the way."

"Eh, I always found your kind to be kind of cute." She giggles. "Besides, that means you owe me for saving you."

"Oh, okay. What do I owe you?" You ask, a bit nervous. The Poipole gives off a great big smile, as she responds with...
1323323432231.title: Giant Adhesive

choices: Let me have a taste of you"
13233234322312.content:
"Oh, in due time my itsy, bitsy friend. I'll tell you once we get to some shelter." The Poipole says in a bit of a sadistic tone, which brings a shiver of worries down your spine rather than cold.

The path that the Poipole is taking seems very weird, with weird rock geometry and moss growing everywhere, until you catch eye of a small entrance to a cave, which the Pokemon easily squeezes into. The cave is surprisingly warm, but moist and dank.

"How is it so warm in here?" You ask the Poipole, as she floats down to the ground, landing softly.

"Oh, this place? Were practically located under a hot springs." She explains, as she walks over to a mossy bed, and lays in it, putting you on her vass pink and purple belly. "So, about that favor you owe me..." The Poipole smiles widely.

"O-oh, yeah, you never really told me what that was..." You nervously say, a bit scared. You don't even know what she even has planned for you, but that expression on her face makes you nervous about your whole well being.

"Well, I was thinking you could...
13233234322312.title: Vague Outcome

132332343223121.content:
let me taste you." The Poipole says with her continuing grin. Your heart skips a beat when you hear the favor. What does she mean by a taste, you think. Does she mean, like, a lick, or does she want me into her mouth?

"What do you mean 'taste'?" You ask, worried about the implications she is giving off.

"I mean full body to mouth taste." She says, pointing to her mouth. "I really want to know what you humans taste like."

You shudder, the thoughts of being fully enclosed in another living being's mouth scares you a bit. What scares you moreover is the thoughts of you being eaten alive. "Wait, I just want you to promise me that you won't swallow me while you do.... that."

The Poipole pats you in the head. "I promise. I'm just curious to what you taste like, that's all." The thought that she doesn't intend any serious harm makes you feel a bit better about the situation. "Well, there's no point in delaying the inevitable." She picks you up from her belly and lifts you to the air, letting you hover over her head.

She lowers you down to her maw, which glows a similar bright cyan to her eyes. Not only that, but you notice she doesn't have any teeth either. She then drops you into her mouth, and closes it with an audible Nom.

Though her mouth is closed, you can still see the interior due to its glowy nature. The tongue below you starts to move, as she presses your body onto the roof of her mouth, suckling a bit on your body. Though it startles you a bit, you notice that the Poipole is not pressing on you too hard. You would even say it's a bit enjoyable, if it wasn't for the saliva also around you.

You then hear a noise come from the back of the throat behind you, the Poipole finds your taste...
132332343223121.title: Into the Mouth

choices: Accept Poipole's Offer; She's The Only Hope You Have Left
Refuse Poipole's Offer; She's Too Suspicious To Trust
Talk This Over With Poipole; Find Out If There Are Any More Conditions
132332343223122.content: "…rub something for me…?" the pokemon said, her devious grin spreading ever wider. "You see, lately I've been having this incredibly feverish 'itch' that I've been dying to scratch, but my arms are too small and my tail isn't good enough. That, my little human, is where you come in…" Poipole sat against the wall of the cave and with her legs apart, and it was then for the first time that you noticed a fluorescent blue slit smack dab on the bottom of her body. Almost immediately you paled at the implication Poipole was getting at, and seeing your face made the strange pokemon grin wider still—eyes narrowing in mischief. "From the look on your face, I don't really have much else to say do I~? You scratch my back—or rather my itch…" Poipole changed her position and laid on her stomach, propping her head up with her arms to stare at you. "…and I'll scratch yours~. So, human, we have a deal?" Poipole held out one of her stubby arms to you in a sort of handshake gesture, but you didn't immediately respond to her. There was something about her that made you incredibly uncomfortable despite the fact that she saved your life from certain doom—but now, it seems as though she saved you for this purpose. What if she wasn't going to help you get back to normal and simply use you to satisfy her wants and needs? Still, you couldn't deny that for better or worse, life for you from this point onward was never going to be the same whether you grew back to normal or not. So many things could happen to you in the future, and it all rested upon this moment. Should you pleasure the pokemon or deny her and hope that God or whatever powers that be would take mercy on you?
132332343223122.title: Rub Something For Me

choices: Let Poipole Lightly "Mark" You; No Other Pokemon Can Claim You
Let Poipole Heavily "Mark" You; No Other Female Can Claim You
Dissuade Poipole From "Marking" You Yet; You Weren't Ready For This
1323323432231221.content:
After some hesitation, you finally came to the decision that you'd do as the pokemon asked you to. You were in a precarious position and she seemed to be your only way out of it, so with this in mind you extended your arm out to Poipole's to "seal the deal". Poipole flashed you a wide grin and accepted your hand.
         "A pleasure doing business with you, human~," Poipole said. "Now, let's get right to it." The pokemon raised herself back up into a sitting position, revealing her privates to you once more. "I've heard from other pokemon that humans are really good at these kinds of things, so I hope you don't disappoint…" With nothing else but to get this ordeal over with, you sighed in resignation and made your way over to the pokemon's privates. Poipole slouched in her seat to grant you more access to her, and soon you noticed that her orifice wasn't like that of a human's; it resembled a cloaca of sorts, and you resisted the urge to cringe a little—a cloaca was both a pokemon's vagina and anus where they were impregnated, laid eggs from, and last but not least excreted their waste from. Shuddering, you hoped that Poipole had some sense of hygiene lest you ended up with questionable things all over your hands. From the looks of it, Poipole was already slick with what you hoped was lubricant, and without delaying a moment longer you took your hands and placed them at the edges of Poipole's orifice to get straight to work.
         Your hands firmly massaged the fluorescent flesh, kneading the walls every now and again, and Poipole voiced her satisfaction with your starting efforts.
         "Oooh~…not bad, human," the pokemon giggled. "I wonder if you've done this before…" You explained to Poipole that you were a virgin—you had never experienced sex before, though that had done nothing to lower the pokemon's expectations. "From the way you are touching me, I would have thought otherwise. Just keep up the pace and you'll do nicely." You obliged the pokemon, keeping a steady rhythm as your hands explored as much real estate as they could and throwing in firm squeezes whenever you could.
         "Mmmmm~…" After some time Poipole frequently cooed softly in approval of your touches, simply sitting back and letting you do your thing. "Ahhhh, yesss~… Hey, human—think you can go a little faster…?" At her urging you did just that, speeding up your pace and causing the pokemon to leak more of her fluids out onto you as she moaned in sheer euphoria. As for you, the effect her pleasured voice was having on you made your little john stand out long and hard, straining painfully in the warm air—and whether it was the musk wafting from Poipole's aroused orifice or her voice, your mind seemed to slowly slip into sexual delirium. Soon, emboldened by your increasing lust, you spread Poipole's hole open a little further and stuck your tongue out to slather your spit all over her inner walls. That earned you a throaty groan from the pokemon, and after a few more moments of tasting her you hear Poipole suck in a sharp breath—you only had a short amount of time to just barely regain yourself as the pokemon let out one last groan, and then you found yourself caught in the wake of her powerful orgasm. You were knocked flat to your back, covered nearly from head to toe, and the shock from such a powerful wave hitting you had cleared up the haze of lust that had overtaken you. Despite having just orgasmed, Poipole herself seemed to be fine enough to stand up just fine.
         "Ahhhh~, I needed that…" Poipole sighed. "That was a wonderful job, human. Now I can't help but imagine how good you'll be when you're big enough for me…" The implication that Poipole wanted more of you once you were back to normal was both arousing and concerning. When you tried to get up, however, you found yourself stuck to the ground thanks to Poipole's emission, and while you quickly began struggling to break free from the sticky substance Poipole laughed at your misfortune (though not out of any malice). "Oops, I forgot to mention that my…bodily fluids act as adhesives—don't worry, you won't be stuck like that for much longer, but since I have you down there I want to strike another deal with you." The pokemon got down on her fours and looked down from right over your immobilized form.
         "I'll help you grow back to normal—a deal is a deal after all, but in addition to helping you, I was wondering how you might feel about becoming my mate~?" Your eyes flew wide open at Poipole's offer of letting you bed her as a mate—a pokemon and human having such relationships weren't so unheard of, but they were still far and few in-between with most never letting their secret slip. "However, I'm going to let you know right now that I am pretty picky about my mates, and that includes wanting my mates mostly to myself if I can help it. The best way to do that is to let all other potential rivals know that you are mine, and what better way to do that than to…mark my territory?" Almost right away you recoiled from what that meant, and while the idea of having sex with a pokemon was somewhat enticing you didn't want that at the cost of what Poipole implied she would do to you next.
         "Now, I'm sure you probably have some potential human mates in mind, so if you want I'll only mark you enough to let every other pokemon know that they can't have you; any other human will never be able to notice the scent. On the other hand, if you don't have any potential human mates in mind that you want to claim for life, then I can heavily mark you to let every other female know that you're mine, human or otherwise. With me as your mate, I'll make sure that you'll never have to want or need any other~… How does that sound?" There was a lot to consider about Poipole's offer—if she marked you period then that limited how many other "mates" you might want in the future, though she was considerate enough to consider allowing you to have at least one female human mate of your choice while keeping all other pokemon away from you. It sounded as though she would prefer if you let her mark you thoroughly so that no other female could lay a claim to you, but even that was somewhat mitigated by how she spoke of making so that you'd never have to want any other mate. In any case, you'd have to make your decision soon…
1323323432231221.title: Accept Poipole's Offer; She Is The Only Hope Left
